And yes, the moment has finally arrived: The first trailer for this action-packed sequel is here. Judging by the intriguing action sequences with huge explosions and sword fights, this movie is shaping up to be the sequel we've all been waiting for.\n\nStarring Paul Mescal in the lead role as Lucius, the trailer offers a very exciting glimpse into the epic battles and brutal war that await in the world of \"Gladiator.\" If you haven't yet seen the three-minute trailer or just want to experience it again (don't worry -- I've watched it a few times just to see Pedro Pascal wield a sword), then check it out below:\n\nPicking up years after the original movie, the sequel looks poised to continue the legacy of its predecessor with a fresh yet familiar intensity. \"Gladiator 2\" shifts the focus to new characters while still maintaining connections to the original narrative. This is especially true since there are several flashbacks in the trailer of when Lucius was a child.\n\nLucius (Mescal) is the now-adult son of Lucilla (Connie Nielsen) and nephew of Commodus (Joaquin Phoenix), who was inspired by the heroism of Maximus (Russell Crowe) in the original movie. Lucius must navigate the dangerous and complex political landscape of the Roman Empire, with the movie exploring the enduring legacy of Maximus.\n\nThe official synopsis for this highly anticipated movie reads: \"The story follows Lucius, the former heir to the Roman Empire, who becomes a gladiator after his home is invaded by the Roman army, led by General Marcus Acacius (Pedro Pascal), during the reign of co-emperors Caracalla (Fred Hechinger) and Geta (Joseph Quinn).\"\n\nDenzel Washington also takes on the role of Macrinus, a wealthy arms dealer who uses gladiators for sport, along with Rory McCann as Tegula and Derek Jacobi as Gracchus. Lucillia is the mother of Lucius Verus, the character being played by Mescal. He was previously portrayed by Spencer Treat Clark in the 2000 movie.\n\nAlso starring in Gladiator II are Derek Jacobi, Joseph Quinn, Fred Hechinger, Lior Raz, Peter Mensah, Matt Lucas, May Calamawy, Tim McInnerny, and Alexander Karim.\n\nThe script for Gladiator II was written by David Scarpa, based on a story by Scarpa (who recently worked with Scott on 2023's Napoleon) and Peter Craig. Scott produces the movie alongside Douglas Wick, Lucy Fisher, Michael Pruss, and David Franzoni, while Walter Parkes, Laurie MacDonald, Raymond Kirk, and Aidan Elliot serve as executive producers.\n\nMescal previously said of his character in Gladiator II, via Vanity Fair, \"He wants nothing to do with the image of Rome. He wants nothing to do with it other than to tear it apart initially. The Romans were some savage, savage individuals. They would go from continent to continent and just destroy communities and nations. The film doesn't shy away from the kind of brutality of that, and the emperors at the center of it, and this kind of corrupted power that he can see through. There's a wonderful clarity to him. He's unafraid of the establishment in a way that makes him dangerous to the establishment.\"\n\nGladiator II releases in United States theaters on November 22, 2024, from Paramount Pictures.", {"uri": "8217131479", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-07-09", "time": "14:29:41", "dateTime": "2024-07-09T14:29:41Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-07-09T14:27:51Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.7490196228027344, "url": "https://www.screengeek.net/2024/07/09/gladiator-2-trailer/", "title": "First Trailer For 'Gladiator 2' Released", "body": "Ridley Scott's hit 2000 blockbuster Gladiator is finally getting a sequel. The new film, appropriately-titled Gladiator II, will follow Paul Mescal as Lucius, who must become a gladiator after the Roman army invades his home. Fans can see the beginning of this new story in the Gladiator 2 trailer shared below.\n\nLucius, of course, is the young child from the first Gladiator movie. While he is the son of Roman Empress Lucilla and Lucius Verus, many fans have since theorized that he could actually be the son of Russell Crowe's Maximus. It's possible that we may even learn of his potential affair with Lucilla in the sequel, though for now we know young Lucius will use what he learned from Maximus to make his own way as a gladiator.\n\nIt's an interesting premise for a sequel, especially so many decades after the first movie was released. And, in addition to Mescal as the young gladiator, fans can also expect to see Pedro Pascal, Connie Nielsen, and Denzel Washington.\n\nA sequel to the original Gladiator had been discussed ever since the first film was released. Now, more than two decades later, it's finally happening. It's a massive endeavor for Paramount, with the budget ranging between $250 million and $310 million. Hopefully, then, the sequel will be able to perform well enough at the box office - and, if not, hopefully fans will at least be satisfied by this continuation of the epic historical drama which managed to make $465.4 million at the box office in 2000.\n\nStay tuned to ScreenGeek for any additional updates regarding Gladiator II as we have them. Hopefully this long-awaited sequel to Ridley Scott's modern classic will meet the expectations of fans. The long-anticipated sequel is set for release on Nov. 22.\n\nThe sequel picks up years later with Lucius now living in the northern African region of Numidia, where he was sent by his mother as a child as it was just outside the reach of the Roman Empire. Events bring Lucius back to Rome as a gladiator, where he makes new enemies and reunites with his mother.\n\nThe supporting cast features Pedro Pascal as Marcus Acacius, a Roman general who trained under the command of Maximus Decimus Meridius (Russell Crowe from \"Gladiator\"), Denzel Washington as Macrinus, a wealthy powerbroker in Rome who keeps a stable of gladiators for sport, and Joseph Quinn and Fred Hechinger as the twin emperors of Rome.\n\nRidley Scott recently told Vanity Fair that he became a fan of Mescal's after watching the actor's breakthrough performance in \"Normal People.\" The two men only spoke for about a half hour when Scott decided that Mescal was his \"Gladiator 2\" lead. The actor bulked up so much for the film that co-star Pascal told the publication it was quite challenging having to face off against him in the arena. Pascal even gave Mescal a nickname on set: \"Brick Wall Paul.\"\n\n\"He got so strong. I would rather be thrown from a building than have to fight him again,\" Pascal added. \"To go up against somebody that fit and that talented and that much younger...It's brutal, man.\"\n\nIn the original \"Gladiator,\" Russell Crowe starred as Maximus, a Roman general who is betrayed by Commodus and reduced to slavery and to fighting as a gladiator as he seeks to avenge his family. Maximus also saves the lives of Lucius and Lucilla. The film was a box office success and took of several Oscars, including best picture and best actor. {"uri": "8217007390", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-07-09", "time": "13:12:53", "dateTime": "2024-07-09T13:12:53Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-07-09T13:12:34Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.7450980544090271, "url": "https://www.hollywoodreporter.com/movies/movie-news/gladiator-sequel-trailer-paul-mescal-denzel-washington-1235941094/", "title": "'Gladiator II' Trailer Brings Paul Mescal, Denzel Washington Into the Arena", "body": "Paramount Pictures releases the historical drama feature in theaters on Nov. 22. Starring Mescal, Pedro Pascal, Denzel Washington, Joseph Quinn and Connie Nielsen, the film is director Scott's follow-up to his 2000 epic Gladiator that starred Russell Crowe and Joaquin Phoenix and collected five Oscars, including best picture.\n\nSet several decades after the events of the first movie, Gladiator II centers on Lucius (Mescal) -- the grandson of former Roman emperor Marcus Aurelius -- who resides with his family in Numidia. After ending up in slavery following an invasion led by Roman general Marcus Acacius (Pascal), Lucius follows the inspiration of Maximus (played by Crowe in the original Gladiator) and focuses on competing as a gladiator.\n\nScott directed Gladiator II from a script by David Scarpa. Scott, Lucy Fisher, David Franzoni, Michael Pruss and Douglas Wick serve as producers.\n\nParamount debuted footage from the sequel at CinemaCon in Las Vegas earlier this year, where Scott said in a featurette of the new film, \"It is possibly even more extraordinary than the first.\" He added that despite arriving more than two decades after Gladiator, the follow-up feature is \"well worth the wait.\"\n\nGladiator II is a big swing for Paramount and comes as the studio's parent company is set to be acquired by a consortium led by Skydance. The sequel saw its budget expand over the course of a shoot that was put on pause last year amid Hollywood's strikes. The first Gladiator was the second-highest grossing title of 2000, surpassing $465 million at the global box office ($848 million today).\n\nMescal is known for his breakout role in the series Normal People, in addition to his work in the features Aftersun, All of Us Strangers and Foe.\n\nThe Hollywood Reporter recently included Mescal on its list of 10 performers who comprise Hollywood's new A-list, alongside such stars as Timoth\u00e9e Chalamet, Zendaya and Jenna Ortega. You've got a pre-established brand with big names attached to it? Yeah, sure, you can have just a whole bunch of money! And here we are, 24 years after the original Gladiator, with a sequel, director Ridley Scott at the helm once more. The film has been a long time coming, having been announced in 2018, and today after all that time the first trailer for Gladiator 2 has been released, showing off Paul Mescal (Normal People) in all his buff, bloody, sweaty glory.\n\nGladiator 2 picks things up decades after the original film, with Mescal playing Lucius, a character that was actually in the original film - he's the son of Lucilla, and the nephew of Emperor Commodus, who was portrayed by Joaquin Phoenix back in the day (Lucius was played by Spencer Treat Clark at the time, with Mescal taking over the role). After spending some time in the northern African region of Numidia, Lucius finds himself back in Rome as a gladiator (like the name of the film!) where, as the trailer above will show you, he eventually faces off against the film industry's daddy, Pedro Pascal (The Mandalorian).\n\nThe rest of the cast is pretty stacked too, including Denzel Washington (Malcolm X), Joseph Quinn (A Quiet Place: Day One) and Connie Nielsen (One Hour Photo), who is reprising her role as Lucilla from the first film. Like I had every amenity available to me. I had a great trainer. People telling me what and when to eat.\n\nPaul Mescal has revealed that he 'loved' the training for Gladiator 2 despite how gruelling it was physically\n\nDue for release later this year, the Irish actor, 28, takes on the role of Roman Empire Lucius Verus, the grown-up son of Lucilla, portrayed as a child in the Oscar-winning original from 2000 starring Russell Crowe\n\n'And I think it's just a by-product. You have to train hard to be in a film like this and I kind of loved it. Of course, it gets tiresome at certain moments.'\n\nIt comes after Paul was seen shirtless with a burlap skirt on and gold cuffs on his wrists in his trailer while on the set of Gladiator 2.\n\nThe image was shared by his costar Pedro Pascal on social media on Monday. Paul plays Lucius and Pedro is Marcus Acacius.\n\nIn the shot, Paul smiles while wearing a fake scar and a slight beard with his locks in disarray.\n\nPedro captioned the snap, along with a poster for the film, 'Come and get it. #Gladiator2 November 22.'\n\nFans flocked to the comments section to share their thoughts on the photo, with one user writing, 'This is a lot for a Monday,' while another chimed in, 'Let's get em papa.'\n\nThe long-awaited Gladiator sequel, directed by Ridley Scott, will debut 24 years after the original historical film aired in 2000.\n\nAt the time, the OG flick won five Oscars from its 11 nominations, including Best Picture and Best Actor for Russell Crowe's portrayal of gladiator Maximus.\n\nAnd speaking in a new interview on Capital Radio with Jordan North on Tuesday, Paul said that the brutal schedule and physical nature of filming was merely a 'first world problem'\n\nJordan asked him of preparing for the huge blockbuster: 'Was it a hard, brutal schedule or was it okay when you could just eat everything you wanted?'\n\nThe long-awaited Gladiator sequel, directed by Ridley Scott , will debut 24 years after the original historical film aired in 2000\n\nPaul then replied: 'It's a first world problem. Like I had every amenity available to me. I had a great trainer. People telling me to eat when to eat'\n\nGladiator 2 centers on the 28-year-old's character, Lucius Verus, the son of Lucilla (Connie Nielsen).\n\nViewers will now see Lucius all grown up, with the story taking place years after the first film ended.\n\nFans of the series will remember that Lucius is also the nephew of Marcus' son Commodus (Joaquin Phoenix), who killed his father to seize the throne.\n\nIn Gladiator, Commodus fought Maximus in the gladiator ring and became mortally wounded.\n\nHowever, the warrior managed to puncture the emperor and save the young boy and his mother while avenging his own wife and son's death, something that made a lasting impact on Lucius.\n\nRead MoreEXCLUSIVE Gladiator 2 star Paul Mescal is seen in character as battered and bloodied Lucius for the FIRST time\n\nThe star-studded cast also includes Denzel Washington, Derek Jacobi, Joseph Quinn, Fred Hechinger, and Lior Raz.\n\nDavid Scarpa scripted the sequel, while Ridley, Douglas Wick, Lucy Fisher, Michael Pruss and David Franzoni produced the film.\n\nWalter Parkes, Laurie MacDonald, Raymond Kirk, and Aidan Elliott also serve as executive producers.\n\nIn a first look at the film, Paul sported a full suit of armor in one scene, while blood dripped down his face and dirt covered his arm.\n\nAnother image showed the Irish actor wielding a sword as he prepared for battle.\n\nA third shot showed Pedro in the gladiator ring, mid-action, as a sword comes his way.\n\nTalking to Vanity Fair earlier this month, Paul described his character as 'a very, very good general, which can mean a very good killer.'\n\n'I just wanted to be big and strong and look like somebody who can cause a bit of damage when shit hits the fan,' he continued about physically preparing for the role. 'I think also, sometimes, one could, in striving for that perfect look, end up looking more like an underwear model than a warrior.'\n\nAnd getting in shape gave Paul a stronger sense of self.\n\n'Muscles start to grow, and that can be deemed aesthetic in certain capacities, but there is something about feeling strong in your body that elicits just a different feeling. You carry yourself differently,' the Aftersun actor noted.\n\n'It has an impact on you psychologically in a way that is useful for the film.'\n\nPedro also chimed in about going up against his costar in Gladiator 2.\n\n'It's brutal, man. I call him Brick Wall Paul,' the 49-year-old confessed to the outlet.\n\n'He got so strong. I would rather be thrown from a building than have to fight him again.\n\n'To go up against somebody that fit and that talented and that much younger... Outside of Ridley being a total genius, Paul is a big reason as to why I would put my poor body through that experience.'\n\nRussell Crowe portrayed Roman general Maximus Decimus Meridius in the original and won the Oscar for Best Actor for his work in the film\n\nAs for why Paul himself said yes to the grueling role? As he put it to AnOther Magazine in February, 'Gladiator 2 comes across your desk and there's no way you say no to it.'\n\nThe All of Us Strangers alum added: 'But with this scale of film, and to work with Ridley Scott, it's a no-brainer. Up until this point there have been very few larger films that remotely interested me.'\n\nPaul reflected: 'It feels really right. And also there's the capacity to learn. It's the first time that I've felt a pressure of, 'God, I'm worried about box office receipts.'\n\n'It's a different metric. But Ridley shoots at a very different rhythm - he's quick and it's kinetic and wonderful. He knows exactly what he wants. {"uri": "8212772862", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-07-06", "time": "15:26:12", "dateTime": "2024-07-06T15:26:12Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-07-06T15:24:38Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.7411764860153198, "url": "https://screenrant.com/gladiator-2-movie-denzel-washington-oliver-reed-proximus-replacement/", "title": "Denzel Washington's Gladiator 2 Role Sounds Like The Perfect Replacement For One Original Movie Character", "body": "Gladiator 2's Biggest Maximus Theory Looks A Lot More Likely Now Summary Gladiator 2 centers on Lucius, a former heir-to-the-Roman-Empire-turned-gladiator who has connections to the original film's characters. Denzel Washington's character, Macrinus, serves as a Proximo replacement by sponsoring gladiators. Macrinus has a grudge against the co-emperors and may have a change of heart, potentially aiding Lucius in the sequel.\n\nDenzel Washington's Gladiator II role echoes a storyline from the original movie, making the actor's character a perfect replacement for one of the 2000 movie's most memorable personalities. Directed by Ridley Scott, Gladiator 2 is a sequel to the filmmaker's Oscar-winning Gladiator. While the first film followed Russell Crowe's Maximus, a betrayed Roman general-turned-gladiator, Gladiator 2 centers on Lucius (Paul Mescal). A former heir to the Roman Empire, Lucius becomes a gladiator only after general Marcus Acacius (Pedro Pascal) invades his home under the rule of co-emperors Caracalla (Joseph Quinn) and Geta (Fred Hechinger).\n\nAny Gladiator 2 cast and character guide will reiterate that legacy is a key part of the sequel. After all, Lucius is the grandson of Rome's former emperor, Marcus Aurelius (Richard Harris), who was murdered by his power-hungry son, Commodus (Joaquin Phoenix) at the beginning of Gladiator. Marcus Aurelius' death is what prompts Maximus' entire story arc. Needless to say, the ramifications of Commodus' actions are still shaping his descendants' lives decades later. However, Lucius is far from the only Gladiator 2 character who echoes someone from Scott's original film -- case in point being Denzel Washington's character, Macrinus.\n\nDenzel Washington's Gladiator 2 Character Can Fulfill The Role Of Proximo Macrinus Is A Sponsor Of Gladiators In Ridley Scott's Sequel Close\n\nIn the wake of Marcus Aurelius' murder, Crowe's Maximus is enslaved and, eventually, purchased by a gruff gladiator trainer called Antonius Proximo (Oliver Reed). Based on the few details released about Gladiator 2, it sounds like Denzel Washington's Macrinus will fill a similar role to Gladiator's Proximo. Scott has shared that Denzel Washington's Gladiator 2 character, Macrinus, is a formerly enslaved person who has gone on to gain great wealth and influence. While Macrinus initially found success as a merchant, he eventually became a sponsor of gladiators. In short, he's an arms dealer who's heavily involved in Rome's gladitorial scene.\n\n...there's no denying the parallels between Washington's character and Reed's gladiator trainer.\n\nWith both Lucius and Marcus Acacius, Pedro Pascal's Gladiator 2 character, pushed into being gladiators for various reasons, it's pretty clear how and why Macrinus figures into the story. Still, there's no denying the parallels between Washington's character and Reed's gladiator trainer. In the original film, Proximo enslaves warriors like Maximus and Juba (Djimon Hounsou), Maximus' ally, and even reveals that he was freed from being enslaved as a gladiator by the late Marcus Aurelius. In Gladiator 2, Washington's Macrinus is an arms dealer with a stable of gladiators, making his character the perfect Proximo replacement from a narrative standpoint.\n\nRelated 2024 Now Has A Box Office Battle To Rival Barbenheimer\n\nUniversal Pictures announced that Wicked, an adaptation of the Broadway musical, will be released a week earlier, setting up 2024's Barbenheimer.\n\nWill Denzel Washington's Gladiator 2 Character End Up Helping Paul Mescal's Lucius? Macrinus Also Has Reason To Hate Gladiator 2's Co-Emperors Close\n\nGladiator's Proximo really can't be considered a good person. Although he mentors Maximus and Juba and aids their revenge quest, he also enslaves the men. According to Vanity Fair, Washington's Gladiator 2 character is considered \"cruel\" by his own stable-full of gladiators. A formerly enslaved person himself, Macrinus grows his power by leveraging the same corrupt system that harmed him in the first place. While Macrinus is described as having a grudge against the emperors, he seems more like a secondary antagonist. Of course, Macrinus might have a change of heart and aid Lucius before Gladiator 2's credits roll.\n\nGladiator II is slated for a November 22, 2024 theatrical release.\n\nGladiator II Not Yet RatedActionDramaEpicHistory\n\nGladiator 2 is the follow-up to Ridley Scott's award-winning film Gladiator from 2000. Scott returns to direct the sequel, with Paul Mescal staring as Lucius, alongside Denzel Washington and Barry Keoghan as the villain Emperor Geta. Gladiator 2 had been stuck in development hell for years before a script written by David Scarpa finally moved forward.\n\nDirector Ridley Scott Release Date November 22, 2024 Studio(s) Paramount The star-studded cast, including Paul Mescal, Denzel Washington, and Pedro Pascal, adds excitement to the sequel. Despite initial doubts, the trailer indicates that Gladiator 2 could be one of the best movies of the year.\n\nGladiator 2's first trailer has been released, and it looks better than I ever imagined. When Ridley Scott announced his plans to direct a Gladiator sequel two decades after the first movie, I had doubts about whether this was a good idea. Still, compared to the number of legacy sequels and reboots released every year, Gladiator 2 did sound like a more interesting project. That said, considering how difficult it is to replicate the magic of a classic like Gladiator, I needed to see what the first trailer was going to look like first.\n\nNaturally, there were a lot of reasons to be excited about the sequel even before the trailer came out. This includes the Gladiator 2 cast, which includes names like Paul Mescal, Denzel Washington, Pedro Pascal, Connie Nielsen, and Joseph Quinn. Although it is no surprise that a Ridley Scott movie looks good, there were a lot of reasons to be concerned about what Gladiator 2 was going to be like. It may be too soon to say whether the sequel will work, especially compared to the first movie, but the trailer is brilliant. theaters.\n\nHere is what to know about the much-anticipated movie:\n\nThe story continues the epic saga set in Ancient Rome.\n\nYears after witnessing the death of revered hero Maximus at the hands of his uncle, Lucius (Paul Mescal) is forced to enter the Colosseum after his home is conquered by the tyrannical Emperors who now lead Rome with an iron fist.\n\nWith rage in his heart and the future of the Empire at stake, Lucius must look to his past to find strength and honor to return the glory of Rome to its people.\n\nRidley Scott returns as director for \"Gladiator II.\"\n\nHe received much acclaim for directing \"Gladiator\" in 2000, and was nominated for Best Director at the Oscars that year.\n\nThe 86-year-old is also an accomplished producer behind films such as \"Blade Runner\" and \"Thelma & Louise.\"\n\nSeveral big Hollywood names signed on to star in \"Gladiator II\" - Paul Mescal, Pedro Pascal, Joseph Quinn, Fred Hechinger, Lior Raz, Derek Jacobi, Connie Nielson and Denzel Ridley Scott's upcoming directorial stars Paul Mescal in the role of a grown-up Lucius, who was portrayed by Spencer Treat Clark in the original film. The film is set two decades after the events of Russell Crowe's iconic movie. The story unfolds in Numidia, northern Africa, where Lucius was sent by his mother Lucilla to evade the Roman Empire's influence. However, unfolding events compel him to return to Rome, where he becomes a gladiator.\n\nAhead of the trailer release, Paramount Pictures had unveiled the film's first poster on Monday.\n\nExpressing his enthusiasm for the project, Paul Mescal said, \"I'm so excited to present the first official trailer of Gladiator II. Beyond its Academy Awards success, Gladiator also bagged numerous BAFTA awards and two Golden Globes.\n\nGladiator II stars Pedro Pascal alongside Paul Mescal, Joseph Quinn, Fred Hechinger, Lior Raz, Derek Jacobi, Nielsen, and Denzel Washington. The film is slated to release in UK cinemas on November 15, 2024, followed by its US release on November 22, 2024. Nearly 20 years after the death of his beloved hero Maximus at the hands of his uncle, Lucius is forced to enter the Colosseum after his home is invaded by tyrannical emperors. {"uri": "8217328794", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-07-09", "time": "16:36:12", "dateTime": "2024-07-09T16:36:12Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-07-09T16:35:44Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.7372549176216125, "url": "https://comicbook.com/movies/news/gladiator-ii-paul-mescal-pedro-pascal-denzel-washington-character-posters-trailer/", "title": "Gladiator II: Character Posters Featuring Paul Mescal, Pedro Pascal, Denzel Washington and More Released", "body": "Gladiator II shows off Joseph Quinn, Connie Nielsen and Fred Hechinger.\n\nGladiator 2 has some new character posters for all the new and returning characters from Ridley Scott's upcoming movie. The trailer for Gladiator 2 has finally premiered and the Internet is feasting on the new images from the movie. Upon the first photos of Denzel Waszhington in his film hitting the timeline, there were some strong reactiosn to what the plot of Gladiator 2 would be. (There's also Paul Mescal and Pedro Pascal fighting in leather armor for those who are so inclined...) Stranger Things Darling Joseph Quinn's look as one of the new emperors has to seen to be believed. Red hair just looks bizarre on Eddie Munson.\n\nStill, these new character posters works wonders in teasing all of the carnage to come in this movie. If there's one thing that Ridley Scott is known for it's that the action sequences are not going to hold back. A lot of fans cheered when their favorite actors were announced for Gladiator 2. But, now they're left wondering if they'll even make it through half of the movie. One thing is for sure, we're in for a wild ride when Gladiator 2 hits theaters. Keep scrolling for more of the character posters from the upcoming movie!\n\nWhat Is Gladiator 2 About?\n\n\"From legendary director Ridley Scott, Gladiator II continues the epic saga of power, intrigue, and vengeance set in Ancient Rome. Years after witnessing the death of the revered hero Maximus at the hands of his uncle, Lucius (Paul Mescal) is forced to enter the Colosseum after his home is conquered by the tyrannical Emperors who now lead Rome with an iron fist. With rage in his heart and the future of the Empire at stake, Lucius must look to his past to find strength and honor to return the glory of Rome to its people.\"\n\nThe cast for Gladiator 2 includes Paul Mescal, Pedro Pascal, Joseph Quinn, Fred Hechinger, Lior Raz, Derek Jacobi with Connie Nielsen and Denzel Washington. David Scarpa penned the screenplay and Peter Craig helped craft the story. Producing the return to Ancient Rome are Ridley Scott, Douglas Wick, Lucy Fisher, Michael Pruss and David Franzoni.\n\nRidley Scott Is Excited To Revisit Gladiator\n\nThis project was announced a while ago. For Scott, returning to one of his most beloved films was a bit of a tall task. He told Deadline that his team really had to get in the lab to ensure that Gladiator 2 would live up to expectations. The initial reactions to Denzel Washington's casting and images of Pedro Pascal and Paul Mescal as main characters help show that they are on the right track with this legacy sequel.\n\n\"I love doing period films. I love the research. I love to create sort of smells of the period,\" Scott said back then. \"I think what we did with the first Gladiator...I don't like being critical of other things that have happened before, but I wasn't the biggest fan of Hollywood Roman epics, honestly. They felt artificial and so, when I was asked to consider a script, the script was not very good. But the person who gave it to me said, I want to show you one thing, and he picked up an illustration, this is true, it's called For Those About to Die by G\u00e9r\u00f4me. He holds it up.\"\n\n\"It's a picture of this big painting of the Coliseum, and in the corner there is this guy, about to tuna fork this poor bastard. He's got this thing in his neck, and he's looking up for permission to kill. I went, bloody hell, that's never been done properly before. Never. I said, I'll do it. He said you will? I said yes. Did you want to read the script? I said no, and we went off and hit the ground running around the table, and evolved the new material.\"\n\nDo you like this new look at Gladiator? {"uri": "8217389187", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-07-09", "time": "17:25:01", "dateTime": "2024-07-09T17:25:01Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-07-09T17:22:31Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.7372549176216125, "url": "https://www.yahoo.com/entertainment/gladiator-ii-paul-mescal-battles-171138077.html", "title": "Gladiator II: Paul Mescal battles a rhino in upcoming film", "body": "The trailer for Ridley Scott's sequel to Gladiator has dropped, showcasing several epic scenes, including a water battle in Rome's Colosseum and Paul Mescal being rammed by a rhino.\n\nAll Of Us Strangers star Mescal plays Lucius, fighting for his life as a gladiator, despite his high status as nephew of corrupt former Emperor Commodus.\n\nSir Ridley's first film in 2000, which starred Russell Crowe as soldier-turned-gladiator Maximus, won five Oscars including best actor.\n\nThe trailer opens as Lucius recalls his childhood memory, when ex-Roman commander Maximus battled his uncle in the arena.\n\n\"I remember that day. I never forgot it, that a slave could take revenge against an emperor,\" Lucius says, before we see him in a flashback from the first film, being dragged to safety by his mother.\n\nA quick recap of the first Gladiator film: the plot revolves around upstanding Roman general, Maximus Decimus Meridius, who was asked to inherit the role of emperor from ailing Marcus Aurelius.\n\nBut Commodus murdered the emperor, took the title, before killing Maximus' family and leaving him a slave. Maximus rose up to become a gladiator, returning to Rome in order to exact his revenge.\n\nWorldhistory.org describes gladiatorial contests as \"bloody entertainment... an opportunity for emperors to display their wealth\", where up to 50,000 spectators enjoyed \"contests which were literally a matter of life and death\".\n\nSome battles included wild animals - Gladiator featured tigers in the arena, while an angry-looking rhino with a bloodied horn charges at Mescal in the sequel.\n\nIt's fair to say the first film caused a flurry of excitement among admirers of Crowe's powerful portrayal of Maximus.\n\nGiven Mescal enjoyed a huge surge in his fanbase after he starred in BBC drama Normal People, it's possible his role in Gladiator II may have a similar impact.\n\nLucius is undoubtedly reminiscent of the honourable Maximus, battling from below while having a much higher purpose.\n\nIn the sequel, Lucius has been captured from his home far from Rome, and brought there as a prisoner.\n\nHe becomes a gladiator, working for Macrinus, played by Denzel Washington, who sponsors fighters much like Oliver Reed's Proximo did in the first film.\n\nLucius protects his birthright, saying he doesn't know where he was born, adding: \"I never knew a mother and or father.\"\n\n\"You will be my instrument,\" Macrinus responds.\n\nIt appears that the twin emperors now in place - played by Joseph Quinn and Fred Hechinger - are also corrupt. We see them laugh demonically while gladiators die in their mock water battle (which did happen in real life).\n\nLucius's mother, Lucilla, played by Connie Nielsen in the original film as well, watches with horror while her son fights beneath her, although we don't know if she recognises him.\n\nShe takes him full circle, back to Maximus, by giving him a ring which belonged to the Roman general before he died.\n\nLike the original, the film appears to be about the corruption of power, as worthy, embattled individuals take on the might of Rome's rulers.\n\nLucius favours \"strength and honour\", while another Roman general, Marcus Acacius, played by The Last of Us star Pedro Pascal, says: \"I will not waste another generation of young men for their vanity,\" alongside footage of the emperors.\n\nWe don't yet know enough about Pascal's character to know where his morals fully lie.\n\nThe trailer ends with Mescal and Pascal battling in the arena with swords, with the gladiator looking like he has the advantage, as he holds two swords crossed over the army general's neck.\n\nInitial responses on X were a mixture of both positive and negative, with some people excited for the sequel, while others said it wouldn't be as good as the original.\n\nSome fans spotted what looked like sharks in the water battle, with filmmaker Kyle Prohaska saying: \"I'm all in on Gladiator II. I'll go just for some of those insane sequences. Sharks in the arena? A rhino? Denzel? Come on. This is definitely one of those sequels nobody asked for, but this one looks better than most.\"\n\nAnother post, from a user called @FilmmakerJeff, called the trailer \"underwhelming\".\n\n\"I hate to report that I'm not a fan of the Gladiator II trailer,\" he said.\n\n\"Terrible music choice, nothing from it gave me reassurance that it could be even close to as good as the original, and honestly, it looks like it could be pretty good at best. My hype meter dropped a notch.\"\n\nThere was also disagreement on social media over the soundtrack, which was No Church in the Wild, by Jay-Z and Kanye West.\n\nOne user wrote: \"In what world does the sequel to Ridley Scott's Gladiator need Jay-Z and Kanye West? Stop shoehorning songs into trailers.\"\n\nAnother in favour though, wrote: \"That pounding hip-hop really works on the Gladiator 2 trailer. Fits so well to the era.\"\n\nSir Ridley, who made 2023's epic Oscar and Bafta-nominated film Napoleon, told Deadline last year that he made Gladiator II because \"economically, it makes sense...\n\n\"I thought the [first] film was, as it were, completely satisfactory, creatively complete, so why muck with it, right?\n\n\"But these cycles keep going on and on and on, they repeat globally for the last 20 years. It started to spell itself out as an obvious thing to do, and that's how it evolved.\"\n\nGladiator II is released in UK cinemas in November.", "source": {"uri": "yahoo.com", "dataType": "news", {"uri": "8217007408", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-07-09", "time": "13:13:03", "dateTime": "2024-07-09T13:13:03Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-07-09T13:12:34Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.7333333492279053, "url": "https://www.digitalspy.com/movies/a61541798/gladiator-2-lucius-maximus/", "title": "How Gladiator 2 connects to the original movie", "body": "Gladiator 2 trailer finally shows how deeply it connects to Ridley Scott's original movie, from some returning characters to Maximus' legacy after his death.\n\nThe highly-anticipated sequel stars Paul Mescal as Lucius, who we met in Gladiator as the son of Connie Nielsen's Lucilla. In an unexpected turn of events for the son of a Roman noblewoman, Lucius ends up embarking on a journey that echoes the struggles of Russell Crowe's character in the first film.\n\nDirected by Scott, the movie also stars The Last of Us actor Pedro Pascal, Denzel Washington and Stranger Things' Joseph Quinn, with Nielsen reprising her role as Lucilla and Sir Derek Jacobi returning as Senator Gracchus.\n\nAs we await for the movie's November release, here's everything you need to know about the story and its many links to Scott's 2000 movie.\n\nSet nearly two decades after the events of the first film, Gladiator II follows Lucius as he grows up far away from Rome and his mother, after Lucilla sends him to the northern coast of Africa when he is just a child.\n\nIn a region called Numidia, just outside of the Roman Empire's reach, Lucius has made a life for himself with his wife and child. However, war comes knocking on his door.\n\n\"He's taken root in a seacoast town in Numidia. He's a blue-eyed, fair-skinned man with red hair, and he couldn't be more different from the inhabitants. It's one of the last surviving civilisations, as the Romans begin to descend in North Africa and take it all over,\" Scott explained to Vanity Fair.\n\nAs it turns out, Rome was not the \"dream\" Maximus imagined it would be after his death.\n\nThe hopeful ending of Gladiator hasn't come to fruition, as a wicked duo of leaders now run the empire. As we see in the first trailer for Gladiator II, Emperor Caracalla (played by Fred Hechinger) and Emperor Geta (Quinn) are dangerous and power-hungry.\n\nMuch like in the first movie, a rebellion starts brewing in order to topple their leadership of the Roman Empire, and Mescal's Lucius becomes a key part in it.\n\nHis thirst for revenge against those responsible for the destruction of his home is intense, and there's someone who can make use of that rage -- powerbroker Macrinus (played by Denzel Washington), an arms dealer who will buy him as a slave and turn him into a gladiator.\n\nAnd we know how gladiators are capable of defying an Emperor (or two).\n\nBeyond the obvious connection with a grown-up Lucius as protagonist, there are other characters directly linking the sequel to the first movie.\n\nConnie Nielsen reprises her role as Lucilla, who doesn't recognise her son when he arrives at the Colosseum as a gladiator. Almost the same way she didn't recognise Maximus when he fought for the first time in Rome in Gladiator! We are expecting an epic reveal scene like in the first movie, of course.\n\nLucilla is now in love with a Roman general, Marcus Acacius (Pedro Pascal), who is connected to Russell Crowe's character too -- he trained as a junior officer under Maximus. He wasn't featured in the first movie, though.\n\n\"This movie has an identity that is shaped by his legacy. It wouldn't make sense for it not to,\" Pascal told Vanity Fair regarding the connections to Maximus, describing his character as a fighter who \"learned from the best, so of course this code of honour is ingrained into his training and into his existence.\"\n\n\"But at the end of the day, he's a different person. And that can't change who he is. Maximus is Maximus, and that can't be replicated. That just makes Acacius capable of different things.\"\n\nRemember how Lucius wants to take revenge after the destruction of Numidia? Well, Marcus Acacius was one of the key generals who led the Roman forces that day, facing Lucius in the battlefield.\n\nNow, Mescal's character is looking for a rematch in the Colosseum, and the Emperors are happy to send Marcus to his demise if that means the masses will be entertained. Where will Lucilla stand in this rivalry between the two men?\n\nNo, Russell Crowe is not in Gladiator 2.\n\nThe actor is featured in the first trailer, though, to remind viewers of his last scene in the first movie. The character died, so the only way he could have been back for the sequel was in a flashback.\n\nHowever, Crowe has repeatedly denied his involvement in the new movie, even saying he is \"slightly uncomfortable with the fact they're making another one.\" (via The Independent)\n\n\"Because, of course, I'm dead and I have no say in what gets done,\" he added.\n\nCrowe might not be part of Gladiator II, but his character still has a special place in the story. In the first trailer, we see Nielsen's Lucilla giving his son Maximus' ring. We also see Lucius admiring Maximus' armour and weapons, which are hanging from a wall.\n\nThe legacy of Russell Crowe's character seems to be very much alive in the sequel, with his vision of what Rome could be still remembered as a possible and hopeful dream for some of the characters.\n\nAs mentioned above, the last connection between Gladiator and Gladiator II is the return of Sir Derek Jacobi as Senator Gracchus, although we don't know how big his role will be for the sequel.\n\nAsked about what Gladiator II is really about, Paul Mescal told Vanity Fair: \"What human beings will do to survive, but also what human beings will do to win.\"\n\n\"We see that in the arena, but also in the political struggle that's going on outside of my character's storyline, where you see there's other characters striving and pulling for power.\n\n\"Where's the space for humanity? Where's the space for love, familial connection? And ultimately, will those things overcome this kind of greed and power? Those things are oftentimes directly in conflict with each other.\"", "source": {"uri": "digitalspy.com", "dataType": "news", "title": "Digital Spy"}, "authors": [], "concepts": [{"uri": Lucius is the son of Lucilla (Connie Nielsen) and the nephew of Commodus, portrayed by Joaquin Phoenix in the first film.\n\nThe film's starry ensemble also includes Joseph Quinn, Fred Hechinger, Lior Raz, and Derek Jacobi. But General Marcus Acacius' (Pascal) invasion of the city forces Lucius into slavery. {"uri": "8217057376", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-07-09", "time": "13:44:53", "dateTime": "2024-07-09T13:44:53Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-07-09T13:44:35Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.7254902124404907, "url": "https://www.heart.co.uk/showbiz/tv-movies/gladiator-2-trailer-release-date-plot-cast/", "title": "Gladiator 2 trailer, release date, plot and full cast revealed", "body": "Gladiator 2 starring Paul Mescal will be released late in 2024 - here's everything you need to know from the plot, trailer and full cast of the highly-anticipated sequel.\n\nIt's been almost a quarter of a century since the film Gladiator was released to the world and now in 2024, Paramount Pictures, is bringing it back with its highly anticipated sequel; Gladiator 2.\n\nWith the trailer dropping on the 9th July, fans of the historical masterpiece will finally get to feast their eyes on Paul Mescal and Pedro Pascal fighting in out as the two stars of the film.\n\nWhilst the original film starred Russell Crowe as the protagonist Maximus, the second film will be set years after and has a fresh cast including the likes of Paul, Pedro, Denzel Washington and Stranger Things' Joseph Quinn.\n\nHowever, Connie Nielson will return to reprise her role as Lucilla, as does Sir Derek Jacobi as Senator Gracchus. Ridley Scott is also returning to direct the sequel.\n\nSo from the plot, trailer and cast, here's everything we know about Gladiator 2.\n\nIf you've watched the first Gladiator film then you'll probably have put together that the second film can't and won't be following Russell's character Maximus Meridius.\n\nGladiator 2 is reportedly set 15-years after Maximus dies in the arena and will follow the story of Lucius Verus, the former emperor of Rome's grandson.\n\nIf you hate to see the change up, don't fret, because you'll still be getting what you know and love from the first Gladiator in its sequel.\n\nAfter his family is overthrown, Lucius is sent to Northern Africa in an attempt to save his life.\n\nHe grows up and builds a family there, but his world is turned upside down when the Roman empire begins to encroach on the new continent, causing him to become a slave forced to fight in the arena.\n\nMuch like Maximus before him, Lucius plans to use the way of the gladiator to avenge his family and contest the overthrowing emperors Caracalla and Geta.\n\nGladiator 2 will touch upon Lucius' childhood, especially his complicated relationship with his mother Lucilla, who was the one who initially sent him away to Africa.\n\nIt's been announced that Gladiator 2 will be released in the UK on 15th November 2024 and in the United States on the 22nd of November.\n\nLucius Verus is the son of Lucilla and the direct descendant of Emperor Marcus Aurelius as well as the rightful heir of Imperial Rome. After their family fell, Lucilla sent Lucius to Numidia for his safety and years passed by before the Roman Empire came knocking at his door once more.\n\nNow with a wife and child, Lucius is taken back to Rome as a prisoner of war and forced into the gladiator arena.\n\nYou may recognise Paul from his huge hits such as Normal People, All Of Us Strangers and Aftersun.\n\nMarcus Acacius is a Roman general who previously trained under Maximus Meridius in the Roman Army. It's Marcus who destroys Numidia and captures Lucius to take back to Rome.\n\nYou'll recognise Pedro Pascal from his iconic roles as Oberyn Martell in Game of Thrones, DEA Agent Javier Pe\u00f1a in Narcos, Din Djarin in The Mandalorian and Joel in The Last of Us.\n\nMacrinus is a former slave who somehow beat the system and managed to gain wealth through arms and commodity dealing, but he holds no love for the Emperors.\n\nMacrinus is heavily involved in the gladiator games and supposedly holds a stable full of fighters.\n\nDenzel Washington surely needs no introduction but you may recognise him from his roles in Oscar-winning films such as Glory and Training Day, or accolades films such as American Gangster and The Equalizer trilogy.\n\nLucilla will be one of the two returning characters in Gladiator 2 as the daughter of Emperor Marcus Aurelius and sister of Emperor Commodus, who was played by Joaquin Phoenix in the first film.\n\nLucilla is a careful political player and finds herself in danger from the new twin Emperors Geta and Caracalla in the current climate.\n\nYou'll recognise Connie Nielsen from the original Gladiator which was her breakout role, as well as DC's Wonder Woman and Wonder Woman 1984.\n\nYou'll remember Senator Gracchus the senator who fought for the restoration of the Roman Republic.\n\nAlongside Lucilla, Senator Gracchus is one of only two returning characters from the first film.\n\nSir Derek Jacobi is a British actor who needs no introduction from Doctor Who, to Othello, Hamlet, The King's Speech, and Murder on the Orient Express, Sir Derek has done it all.\n\nEmperor Geta will be one-half of the sinister new twin co-emperors of Rome. Their partnership showcases the virtuous decline of the Roman empire.\n\nYou'll recognise Joseph Quinn from his role as metalhead Eddie Munson in Stranger Things, although he looks very different.\n\nJoseph's career has kicked off in 2023 as he currently starts in the newest installment of A Quiet Place: Day One alongside Lupita Nyongo as well as being cast as The Human Torch in Marvel's Fantastic Four.\n\nEmperor Caracalla the the other half of the evil emperors who have leaked their darkness all over Rome.\n\nFred Hechinger will mostly be recognised for his roles in The White Lotus and Pam & Tommy.\n\nBut that's hardly where the star-studded cast ends, check out the full list below.", "source": {"uri": "heart.co.uk", "dataType": "news", "title": "Heart"}, "authors": The film stars Paul Mescal, Pedro Pascal, and Denzel Washington, and is scheduled for release on November 22.\n\nWritten by David Scarpa from a story co-created with Peter Craig, 'Gladiator II' is set years after the original film. Paul Mescal takes on the role of Lucius, the son of Lucilla (Connie Nielsen) and nephew of Commodus, portrayed by Joaquin Phoenix in the 2000 film. The plot follows Lucius, who lives peacefully with his family in Numidia until General Marcus Acacius' (Pedro Pascal) invasion forces him into slavery. Inspired by Maximus (played by Russell Crowe in the original), Lucius decides to become a gladiator and challenge the rule of Emperors Caracalla (Fred Hechinger) and Geta (Joseph Quinn).\n\nThe film's star-studded ensemble also includes Lior Raz, Derek Jacobi, and others. The producers are Douglas Wick, Ridley Scott, Lucy Fisher, Michael Pruss, and David Franzoni, with Walter Parkes, Laurie MacDonald, Raymond Kirk, and Aidan Elliott serving as executive producers.\n\n'Gladiator II' will open on November 22, competing with Universal Pictures' 'Wicked' and Angel Studios' drama 'Bonhoeffer.' Paramount's upcoming slate also includes 'Transformers One' on September 20, 'Smile 2' on October 18, 'Sonic the Hedgehog 3' on December 20, and 'Better Man' on December 25.", "source": {"uri": {"uri": "8215434814", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-07-08", "time": "14:31:20", "dateTime": "2024-07-08T14:31:20Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-07-08T14:30:51Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.7215686440467834, "url": "https://www.moneycontrol.com/entertainment/gladiator-ii-official-poster-released-fans-excited-for-ridley-scott-directorial-article-12764713.html", "title": "Gladiator II official poster released; fans excited for Ridley Scott directorial", "body": "Gladiator II is set to hit theaters on November 22, 2024. (Image Credit: Instagram/Vanity Fair)\n\nThe anticipation for Gladiator II had reached fever pitch with the release of its logo and poster, officially confirming the title of the highly awaited sequel just seven months before its release. Now the makers have released the official poster that seems to have intrigued the fans further.\n\nDirector Ridley Scott, who recently helmed Napoleon, returns to direct the follow-up to his Oscar-winning epic. The new film will focus on Lucius, the son of Lucilla, portrayed by Paul Mescal. Lucilla was originally played by Connie Nielsen in the 2000 film.\n\nMescal, who earned an Oscar nomination in 2022 for Aftersun, had mixed feelings about the potential increase in fame that Gladiator II might bring. He had joked that he would be \"profoundly depressed\" if the sequel made him even more famous than he currently is.\n\nConnie Nielsen returns for the sequel, joining an impressive cast that includes Pedro Pascal, Denzel Washington, and Stranger Things star Joseph Quinn. Derek Jacobi will reprise his role as Senator Gracchus. Since the project was first announced, it was informally known as Gladiator 2, but the poster confirmed that the official title is Gladiator II.\n\nThe film's tagline, \"What we do in life echoes in eternity,\" is a quote from Maximus Decimus Meridius in the original film. This nostalgic touch is sure to resonate with fans of the 2000 classic.\n\nThe original Gladiator followed Roman General Maximus Decimus Meridius, played by Russell Crowe, who was forced into slavery following the murder of Emperor Marcus Aurelius, portrayed by Richard Harris. The film was a critical and commercial success, earning 12 Oscar nominations and winning five, including Best Picture.\n\n#### Russell Crowe's Reflections\n\nRussell Crowe, who won an Academy Award for his role in the original film, has denied rumours of a flashback appearance in the sequel. He admitted to feeling \"jealous\" of Mescal's opportunity, reflecting on how the original film was a transformative experience for him. Crowe shared, \"I was a much younger man, obviously, and it was a huge experience in my life. It's something that changed my life, really. It changed the way people regarded me and what I do for a living.\"\n\nGladiator II is set to hit theaters on November 22, 2024. Five days after the posters of Paul Mescal were unveiled, now the makers, Paramount Pictures have unveiled the date of the trailer release and fans of the franchise couldn't be more excited about it.\n\nGladiator II: Paramount Pictures tease audience with a new poster as they announce the trailer release on July 9\n\nNew Poster unveiled\n\nWhile fans are clearly eager to see Paul Mescal take over the role of Gladiator in this 2024 epic historical drama, the makers have teased them with a new poster from the film. Moreover, they have unveiled the same in three different languages, namely, English, Hindi, and Tamil specifically aimed at Indian audiences. Taking to Instagram, Paramount Pictures shared these pictures on Monday, July 8, along with a caption that read, \"Prepare to be entertained. Trailer for #GladiatorII debuts TOMORROW\".\n\nView this post on Instagram\n\nA post shared by Paramount Pictures India (@paramountpicsin)\n\nAbout Gladiator II\n\nIn an interview with Vanity Fair, as the director Ridley Scott and leading Paul Mescal discussed about the way this role landed on the latter, they also shared tidbits about the storyline of this sequel to the 2000 blockbuster. While readers would be aware that the story of Gladiator follows Lucius, the former heir to the Roman Empire, who becomes a gladiator after his home is invaded by general Marcus Acacius during the reign of co-emperors Caracalla and Geta, the sequel takes off several decades after the events of the 180 AD.\n\nThis installment kicks off with Lucius living with his wife and child in Numidia. Roman soldiers led by general Marcus Acacius invade, forcing Lucius into slavery. Inspired by the story of Maximus, Lucius resolves to fight as a gladiator while opposing the rule of the young emperors Caracalla and Geta. Also starring Pedro Pascal, Connie Nielsen, Denzel Washington, along with an ensemble supporting cast, the historical drama will release in cinemas across countries including United Kingdom on November 15 and a week later, in US and Canada, on November 22.\n\nAlso Read: Gladiator II steps out of the Colosseum: First look photos unveil Paul Mescal's Lucius battling Pedro Pascal's Roman "https://internewscast.com/news/us/a-sneak-peek-at-gladiator-ii-paul-mescals-character-lucius-promises-to-continue-the-legacy-of-the-renowned-maximus-by-joining-him-in-battle-as-a-former-heir-turns-warrior-in-the-intense-first-trail/", "title": "A sneak peek at Gladiator II: Paul Mescal's character Lucius promises to continue the legacy of the renowned Maximus by joining him in battle as a former heir turns warrior in the intense first trailer for Ridley Scott's highly anticipated sequel. - Internewscast Journal", "body": "Several decades have passed, but Maximus remains fresh in the memory as Paul Mescal's Lucius Verus picks up the sword in the first official trailer for Ridley Scott's eagerly anticipated Gladiator II.\n\nMescal takes his biggest role to date in this epic historical blockbuster, a blood and gore soaked sequel to Scott's award-winning 2000 triumph, Gladiator.\n\nWith Russell Crow's legendary Maximus long-since dead and buried, it is Lucius - the grandson of Rome's former emperor Marcus Aurelius and son of Lucilla - who must fight for his liberty after being taken into slavery.\n\nA former heir to the Roman empire, Lucius is taken into slavery by Pedro Pascal's Marcus Acacius and his marauding army of troops.\n\nPlayed by 12-year old Spencer Treat Clark in Scott's original film, Lucius is now fully grown and intent on following the lead set by Maximus by forcing his way out of the notorious fighting pits.\n\nAlong the way he encounters and befriends Macrinus, a power broker who keeps a stable of gladiators and sees battle-hungry Lucius as a promising investment.\n\nFans of the original film will remember that Lucius is also the nephew of Marcus' son Commodus, who famously killed his father to seize the throne.\n\nIn Gladiator, Commodus, played by Joaquin Phoenix, was killed while fighting Maximus, who save the young Lucius and his mother while avenging his own wife and son's death.\n\nThe long-awaited Gladiator sequel will debut 24 years after the original historical film was released to commercial and critical acclaim in 2000.\n\nAt the time, Gladiator won five Oscars from its 11 nominations, including Best Picture and Best Actor for Crowe's portrayal of gladiator Maximus.\n\nDavid Scarpa scripted the sequel, while Ridley, Douglas Wick, Lucy Fisher, Michael Pruss and David Franzoni produced the film.\n\nTalking to Vanity Fair, Mescal described his character as 'a very, very good general, which can mean a very good killer.'\n\n'I just wanted to be big and strong and look like somebody who can cause a bit of damage when shit hits the fan,' he continued about physically preparing for the role.\n\n'I think also, sometimes, one could, in striving for that perfect look, end up looking more like an underwear model than a warrior.'\n\nAnd getting in shape gave Mescal a stronger sense of self.\n\n'Muscles start to grow, and that can be deemed aesthetic in certain capacities, but there is something about feeling strong in your body that elicits just a different feeling.\n\n'You carry yourself differently,' the Aftersun actor noted. 'It has an impact on you psychologically in a way that is useful for the film.'\n\nMescal previously admitted he couldn't resist the opportunity to play Lucius after starring in a string of predominantly British features.\n\nHe told AnOther Magazine: 'Gladiator II comes across your desk and there's no way you say no to it.'\n\n'But with this scale of film, and to work with Ridley Scott, it's a no-brainer. Up until this point there have been very few larger films that remotely interested me.'\n\nHe added: 'It feels really right. And also there's the capacity to learn. It's the first time that I've felt a pressure of, \"God, I'm worried about box office receipts.\" It's a different metric.\n\n'But Ridley shoots at a very different rhythm - he's quick and it's kinetic and wonderful. He knows exactly what he wants. Paul plays Lucius and Pedro is Marcus Acacius.\n\nIn the shot, Paul smiles while wearing a fake scar and a slight beard with his locks in disarray.\n\nPedro captioned the snap, along with a poster for the film, 'Come and get it. #Gladiator2 November 22.'\n\nFans flocked to the comments section to share their thoughts on the photo, with one user writing, 'This is a lot for a Monday,' while another chimed in, 'Let's get em papa.'\n\nPaul Mescal was seen shirtless with a burlap skirt on and gold cuffs on his wrists in his trailer while on the set of Gladiator 2\n\nView this post on Instagram\n\nA post shared by IndieWire (@indiewire)\n\nThe long-awaited Gladiator sequel, directed by Ridley Scott, will debut 24 years after the original historical film aired in 2000.\n\nAt the time, the OG flick won five Oscars from its 11 nominations, including Best Picture and Best Actor for Russell Crowe's portrayal of gladiator Maximus.\n\nGladiator 2 centers on the 28-year-old's character, Lucius Verus, the son of Lucilla (Connie Nielsen).\n\nViewers will now see Lucius all grown up, with the story taking place years after the first film ended.\n\nFans of the series will remember that Lucius is also the nephew of Marcus' son Commodus (Joaquin Phoenix), who killed his father to seize the throne.\n\nIn Gladiator, Commodus fought Maximus in the gladiator ring and became mortally wounded.\n\nHowever, the warrior managed to puncture the emperor and save the young boy and his mother while avenging his own wife and son's death, something that made a lasting impact on Lucius.\n\nThe star-studded cast also includes Denzel Washington, Derek Jacobi, Joseph Quinn, Fred Hechinger, and Lior Raz.\n\nDavid Scarpa scripted the sequel, while Ridley, Douglas Wick, Lucy Fisher, Michael Pruss and David Franzoni produced the film.\n\nThe Aftersun star added about physically preparing for the role: 'I just wanted to be big and strong and look like somebody who can cause a bit of damage when shit hits the fan'; seen in June\n\nGladiator 2 centers on the character, Lucius Verus, the son of Lucilla (Connie Nielsen). Viewers will now see Lucius all grown up, with the story taking place years after the first film ended. Fans of the series will remember that Lucius is also the nephew of Marcus' son Commodus (Joaquin Phoenix)\n\nWalter Parkes, Laurie MacDonald, Raymond Kirk, and Aidan Elliott also serve as executive producers.\n\nIn a first look at the film, Paul sported a full suit of armor in one scene, while blood dripped down his face and dirt covered his arm.\n\nAnother image showed the Irish actor wielding a sword as he prepared for battle.\n\nA third shot showed Pedro in the gladiator ring, mid-action, as a sword comes his way.\n\nTalking to Vanity Fair earlier this month, Paul described his character as 'a very, very good general, which can mean a very good killer.'\n\n'I just wanted to be big and strong and look like somebody who can cause a bit of damage when shit hits the fan,' he continued about physically preparing for the role. 'I think also, sometimes, one could, in striving for that perfect look, end up looking more like an underwear model than a warrior.'\n\nAnd getting in shape gave Paul a stronger sense of self.\n\nThe Last of Us actor noted about about going up against his costar in Gladiator 2: 'It's brutal, man. I call him Brick Wall Paul,' the 49-year-old confessed to the outlet. ' He got so strong'\n\n'Muscles start to grow, and that can be deemed aesthetic in certain capacities, but there is something about feeling strong in your body that elicits just a different feeling. You carry yourself differently,' the Aftersun actor noted. 'It has an impact on you psychologically in a way that is useful for the film.'\n\nPedro also chimed in about going up against his costar in Gladiator 2.\n\n'It's brutal, man. I call him Brick Wall Paul,' the 49-year-old confessed to the outlet. 'He got so strong. I would rather be thrown from a building than have to fight him again. To go up against somebody that fit and that talented and that much younger... Outside of Ridley being a total genius, Paul is a big reason as to why I would put my poor body through that experience.'\n\nAs for why Paul himself said yes to the grueling role? As he put it to AnOther Magazine in February, 'Gladiator 2 comes across your desk and there's no way you say no to it.'\n\nThe All of Us Strangers alum added, 'But with this scale of film, and to work with Ridley Scott, it's a no-brainer. Up until this point there have been very few larger films that remotely interested me.'\n\nPaul reflected, 'It feels really right. And also there's the capacity to learn. It's the first time that I've felt a pressure of, \"God, I'm worried about box office receipts.\" It's a different metric. But Ridley shoots at a very different rhythm - he's quick and it's kinetic and wonderful. He knows exactly what he wants. {"uri": "2024-07-416428224", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-07-09", "time": "15:34:41", "dateTime": "2024-07-09T15:34:41Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-07-09T14:59:57Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.7176470756530762, "url": "https://internewscast.com/news/preview-of-gladiator-ii-paul-mescals-lucius-follows-in-maximus-footsteps-as-he-takes-on-the-sword-in-ridley-scotts-thrilling-sequel-trailer/", "title": "Preview of Gladiator II: Paul Mescal's Lucius follows in Maximus' footsteps as he takes on the sword in Ridley Scott's thrilling sequel trailer. - Internewscast Journal", "body": "Several decades have passed, but Maximus remains fresh in the memory as Paul Mescal's Lucius Verus picks up the sword in the first official trailer for Ridley Scott's eagerly anticipated Gladiator II.\n\nMescal takes his biggest role to date in this epic historical blockbuster, a blood and gore soaked sequel to Scott's award-winning 2000 triumph, Gladiator.\n\nWith Russell Crow's legendary Maximus long-since dead and buried, it is Lucius - the grandson of Rome's former emperor Marcus Aurelius and son of Lucilla - who must fight for his liberty after being taken into slavery.\n\nA former heir to the Roman empire, Lucius is taken into slavery by Pedro Pascal's Marcus Acacius and his marauding army of troops.\n\nPlayed by 12-year old Spencer Treat Clark in Scott's original film, Lucius is now fully grown and intent on following the lead set by Maximus by forcing his way out of the notorious fighting pits.\n\nAlong the way he encounters and befriends Denzel Washington's Macrinus, a power broker who keeps a stable of gladiators and sees battle-hungry Lucius as a promising investment.\n\n'You have something in you,' he tells him. 'I knew it from the start... rage is your gift.'\n\nInspired by the feats of Maximus, his prot\u00e9g\u00e9 must fight his way out of 'the greatest temple Rome ever built' in the Colosseum, where sword-wielding soldiers, rampaging rhinos and even Marcus Acacius himself await.\n\nFans of the original film will remember that Lucius is also the nephew of Marcus' son Commodus, who famously killed his father to seize the throne.\n\nIn Gladiator, Commodus, played by Joaquin Phoenix, was killed while fighting Maximus, who save the young Lucius and his mother while avenging his own wife and son's death.\n\nThe long-awaited Gladiator sequel will debut 24 years after the original historical film was released to commercial and critical acclaim in 2000.\n\nAt the time, Gladiator won five Oscars from its 11 nominations, including Best Picture and Best Actor for Crowe's portrayal of gladiator Maximus.\n\nDavid Scarpa scripted the sequel, while Ridley, Douglas Wick, Lucy Fisher, Michael Pruss and David Franzoni produced the film.\n\nTalking to Vanity Fair, Mescal described his character as 'a very, very good general, which can mean a very good killer.'\n\n'I just wanted to be big and strong and look like somebody who can cause a bit of damage when shit hits the fan,' he continued about physically preparing for the role.\n\n'I think also, sometimes, one could, in striving for that perfect look, end up looking more like an underwear model than a warrior.'\n\nAnd getting in shape gave Mescal a stronger sense of self.\n\n'Muscles start to grow, and that can be deemed aesthetic in certain capacities, but there is something about feeling strong in your body that elicits just a different feeling.\n\n'You carry yourself differently,' the Aftersun actor noted. 'It has an impact on you psychologically in a way that is useful for the film.'\n\nMescal previously admitted he couldn't resist the opportunity to play Lucius after starring in a string of predominantly British features.\n\nHe told AnOther Magazine: 'Gladiator II comes across your desk and there's no way you say no to it.'\n\nBut with this scale of film, and to work with Ridley Scott, it's a no-brainer. Up until this point there have been very few larger films that remotely interested me.'\n\nHe added: 'It feels really right. And also there's the capacity to learn. It's the first time that I've felt a pressure of, \"God, I'm worried about box office receipts.\" It's a different metric.\n\n'But Ridley shoots at a very different rhythm - he's quick and it's kinetic and wonderful. {"uri": "8216998861", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-07-09", "time": "13:07:49", "dateTime": "2024-07-09T13:07:49Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-07-09T13:07:22Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.7137255072593689, "url": "https://faroutmagazine.co.uk/trailer-ridley-scott-gladiator-ii-paul-mescal-pedro-pascal/", "title": "First trailer released for Ridley Scott's 'Gladiator II'", "body": "The first trailer for Ridley Scott's upcoming epic historical drama film Gladiator II has now been released and can be viewed at the bottom of this page. Much anticipation has surrounded the sequel to the original movie of 2000 starring Russell Crowe, and now the release of the first trailer has ramped up the excitement another notch.\n\nThe film features Paul Mescal in the biggest role of his career so far as Lucius, the former heir to the Roman Empire who becomes a gladiator after living in estrangement for many years. When his home town is invaded by the Roman Army, led by General Marcus Acacius (Pedro Pascal) during the reign of co-emperors Caracalla and Geta, he vows to oppose their rule, inspired by the story of Maximus from the original film.\n\nConnie Nielsen reprises her role as Lucius' mother, Lucilla, while Denzel Washington plays Macrinus, a potentially manipulative tutor to Lucius, who keeps a stable of Gladiators. Elsewhere, the cast comprises Derek Jacobi, Joseph Quinn, Fred Hechinger, Tim McInnerny, and Alexander Karim.\n\nThe trailer sees Lucius claim that he remembers the day that Maximus fought and killed Joaquin Phoenix's Emperor Commodus, touching the legendary former Army General's suit of armour. Macrinus then admits that he will use the young gladiator as his \"instrument,\" with both characters expressing their desire to see Rome \"fall.\"\n\nThe Gladiator II trailer has moments of humour, particularly from Denzel Washington. However, they are largely overshadowed by intense scenes of dramatic dialogue and action-heavy set pieces in the gladiator's arena, in which Mescal and his fighting allies take up their swords to fight to the death.\n\nGladiator II has been in development for many years, but it was around 2021 that it began to gain traction as a genuine possibility. When Mescal, Pascal and Quinn were announced to have joined the cast in 2023, excitement began to grow for what may well be the most significant cinematic moment of the year, with the film set to be released on November 15th in the United Kingdom and November 22nd in the United States.\n\nRidley Scott had recently spoken of Mescal's casting and said that he was \"absolutely perfect\" for the role of Lucius. He told Vanity Fair, \"I met with him, and he said, 'Of course, I'd love to do it.' And that was it. We were away and running with the ball. He was a special find. Russell Crowe is out and Paul Mescal is in, playing the grown son of Connie Nielsen's character from the first film, Lucius. In an epic journey that mirrors the one Crowe's Maximus went on in \"Gladiator,\" the sequel finds Mescal crossing paths with those who wronged him in the gladiatorial arena with an A-list ensemble that includes Pedro Pascal and Denzel Washington.\n\nDavid Scarpa, with whom Scott collaborated on his 2023 epic \"Napoleon\" and 2017 drama \"All the Money in the World,\" wrote the screenplay based on a story by Scarpa and Peter Craig.\n\nA sequel to \"Gladiator\" has been in the offing since the first film became a runaway hit, but while ideas were explored that would have followed Crowe's character into the afterlife (spoiler alert: he dies), a follow-up never materialized. That is, until Scott came back around to the idea in the last few years and decided to tell the story of what happened to young Lucius.\n\nOnce again set in Ancient Rome, the story of \"Gladiator II\" takes place years after witnessing the death of the revered hero Maximus at the hands of his uncle. Lucius is now forced to enter the Colosseum after his home is conquered by the tyrannical Emperors who lead Rome with an iron fist. With rage in his heart and the future of the Empire at stake, Lucius must look to his past to find strength and honor to return the glory of Rome to its people, per the film's official synopsis.\n\nThe cast also includes Joseph Quinn, Fred Hechinger, Lior Raz and Derek Jacobi. Scott produced the film alongside Douglas Wick, Lucy Fisher, Michael Pruss and David Franzoni. Executive producers are Walter Parkes, Laurie MacDonald, Raymond Kirk and Aidan Elliott.\n\nParamount will release \"Gladiator II\" only in theaters on Nov. 22, including in IMAX and large formats.", {"uri": "2024-07-416326343", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-07-09", "time": "14:02:04", "dateTime": "2024-07-09T14:02:04Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-07-09T13:25:08Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.7098039388656616, "url": "https://clutchpoints.com/gladiator-2-paul-mescal-ridley-scott-movie-first-trailer", "title": "Gladiator 2: Paul Mescal filled with rage in epic first trailer", "body": "The trailer begins with Lucius Verus (Mescal) staring at Maximus's (Russell Crowe) armor from the first movie. Flashbacks are then shown as a young Lucius Verus sees Maximus conquer his enemies in the arena.\n\n\"I remember that day -- I never forgot it,\" he said. \"That a slave could take revenge against an emperor.\"\n\nHe is explaining his unknown origins to Macrinus (Washington), who wants to use Lucius as an \"instrument.\"\n\nA beautiful aerial shot of the Colosseum is shown, which is filled with water. Glimpses of some of the events are shown as co-emperor Geta (Joseph Quinn) watches on, amused.\n\nShots of battles and Lucius training follow. Macrinus promises that he sees potential in Lucius that he wants to fulfill. \"That rage is your gift,\" he tells him.\n\nBy the halfway point of the trailer, Lucius has grown into a leadership role. He gives orders to his fellow warriors as they take on a bloodied rhinoceros.\n\nLater, when asked by Macrinus whose head would satisfy his fury, Lucius replies, \"The entire Roman army's.\"\n\nThat is too much, but he will settle for revenge against the general, Marcus Acacius (Pascal).\n\nTowards the end of the trailer, Lucilla (Connie Nielsen), Lucius' mother, gifts him a ring worn by Maximus. \"What is the dram of Rome if our people are not free?\" she ponders.\n\nThe Gladiator 2 trailer concludes with Lucius and Marcus battling. A quick glimpse of Lucius beheading someone hits the screen before it officially ends.\n\nWhat is Gladiator 2 about?\n\nGladiator 2 takes place decades after the events of the first movie. Lucius, the grandson of Marcus Aurelius and son of Lucilla, has a quiet life with his wife and child. However, after Roman soldiers led by Marcus Acacius invade, he is forced into slavery.\n\nLike Maximus, Lucius has to fight his way to freedom as a gladiator. There are several forces pushing against him aside from Marcus, including young co-emperors Caracalla (Fred Hechinger) and Geta (Joseph Quinn).\n\nWhile Paul Mescal, Pedro Pascal, and Denzel Washington lead the cast, they are all new to the franchise. Connie Nielsen and Derek Jacobi will reprise their roles from the first movie.\n\nRidley Scott once again directs Gladiator 2. He directed the first movie based on a script from David Franzoni, John Logan, and Willian Nicholson. The sequel features a completely different writers' room, only consisting of David Scarpa.\n\nDespite being 86 years old, Scott continues going strong as a filmmaker. He first gained notoriety for directing Alien and Blade Runner. Since then, he has continued churning out movies at a rapid pace.\n\nOver the past decade, Scott has made eight movies, including Gladiator 2. These include 2021's double feature of The Last Duel and House of Gucci. His last movie -- Napoleon -- came out on November 22, 2023.\n\nGladiator remains one of Scott's biggest successes. Not only did it make over $460 million worldwide, the movie was up for 12 Oscars. I hate when studios use modern music.. or rap as the soundtrack for a trailer set in historic periods. It feels lazy to me. Anyway - check it out.'\n\n'Two things: 1. Hip hop doesn't match with ancient Rome. 2. Denzel is one of my favorite actors, but here sounds like Trainning day movie.'\n\n'Didn't like the Gladiator 2 trailer very much. Also, who's decision was it to have Kanye rapping in a GLADIATOR trailer.'\n\n'Oh no, they added hip hop music to the trailer #Gladiator2.'\n\n'Watched the #Gladiator2 trailer and I miss the Hans Zimmer music. Ahh well.'\n\n'The Kanye, Jay Z song spoiled that for me. I get it the lyrics are fitting but... Do you know what was iconic about the first gladiator... It's music. Absolute chilling to listen to, had a huge impact on the experience of the film.'\n\n'In what world does the sequel to Ridley Scott's Gladiator need Jay-Z and Kanye West? Stop shoehorning songs into trailers.'\n\nMovie buffs have taken to X (formerly Twitter ) to express their confusion at the artistic choice\n\n'Was not expecting to hear kanye in the Gladiator 2 trailer today.'\n\n'Visuals are incredible but the rap music destroys the suspension of disbelief. Whoever put that music in the trailer should be fired. And if that's the movie's soundtrack then the Gladiator franchise is finished.'\n\nHowever, not everyone disliked the unique choice and some people took to social media to praise it, adding:\n\n'Who would've imagined a Kanye/Jay Z song could go well with a Gladiator movie trailer?'\n\n'To anybody who says \"Why is there rap music in the GLADIATOR II trailer? It is anachronistic and does not suit the period\" 1. How do you know what suits the period? 2. to praise it\n\nPedro Pascal is Marcus Acacius in the upcoming film\n\nSeveral decades have passed, but Maximus remains fresh in the memory as Paul Mescal 's Lucius picks up the sword in the first official trailer\n\nLucius was played by Spencer Treat Clark in the original 2000 blockbuster (left), now fully gown, he is played by Paul Mescal in the forthcoming sequel (right)\n\nEnslaved by the Roman empire and inspired by Maximus (pictured), Lucius vows to fight his way out of the pits\n\nPlayed by 12-year old Spencer Treat Clark in Scott's original film, Lucius is now fully grown and intent on following the lead set by Maximus by forcing his way out of the notorious fighting pits.\n\nAlong the way he encounters and befriends Macrinus, a power broker who keeps a stable of gladiators and sees battle-hungry Lucius as a promising investment.\n\nFans of the original film will remember that Lucius is also the nephew of Marcus' son Commodus, who famously killed his father to seize the throne.\n\nIn Gladiator, Commodus, played by Joaquin Phoenix, was killed while fighting Maximus, who save the young Lucius and his mother while avenging his own wife and son's death.\n\nThe long-awaited Gladiator sequel will debut 24 years after the original historical film was released to commercial and critical acclaim in 2000.\n\nAt the time, Gladiator won five Oscars from its 11
