{"uri": "8217154622", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-07-09", "time": "14:37:20", "dateTime": "2024-07-09T14:37:20Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-07-09T14:36:44Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.7098039388656616, "url": "https://www.irishcentral.com/culture/entertainment/gladiator-ii-trailer-paul-mescal", "title": "WATCH: Paul Mescal stars in first trailer for \"beast of a film\" \"Glad | IrishCentral.com", "body": "Irish actor Paul Mescal stars in the first official trailer for \"Gladiator II.\" Paramount Pictures, YouTube\n\nPaul Mescal stars in the first official trailer for \"Gladiator II,\" the highly anticipated sequel to the 1990 Oscar-winning film starring Russell Crowe and Joaquin Phoenix.\n\n\"Gladiator II\" \"continues the epic saga of power, intrigue, and vengeance set in Ancient Rome,\" a synopsis from Paramount Pictures says.\n\n\"Years after witnessing the death of the revered hero Maximus at the hands of his uncle, Lucius (Paul Mescal) is forced to enter the Colosseum after his home is conquered by the tyrannical Emperors who now lead Rome with an iron fist.\n\n\"With rage in his heart and the future of the Empire at stake, Lucius must look to his past to find strength and honor to return the glory of Rome to its people.\"\n\nIn \"Gladiator II,\" Paul Mescal stars alongside Pedro Pascal, Joseph Quinn, Fred Hechinger, Lior Raz, Derek Jacobi, Connie Nielsen, and Denzel Washington.\n\nThe new film, directed by Ridley Scott, is set to arrive in theaters on November 22.\n\nJust ahead of the trailer's release on Tuesday, Co Kildare native Mescal chatted with Irish radio station Today FM about the anticipation for the long-awaited trailer.\n\n\"I've seen the trailer, seen the film - I think, from my end, that the hype is kind of warranted.\n\n\"I'm as big a fan of the first film as the next person. And I think it's just indicative of the legacy this film has.\n\n\"Ridley Scott directing the second one, for people who love film, it's a no-brainer.\"\n\nMescal says the new film \"picks the world of the first 'Gladiator' up and plants it 20 years in the future.\n\n\"It has the same energy and spirit of the first one, but the character's journey through the mad world that is ancient Rome couldn't be more different.\n\n\"It balances an honoring of the first film but is very much its own beast, and very much is a beast of a film.\"\n\nMescal said again that his previous GAA training helped with preparations for the physically demanding film role.\n\nWhen he was asked if he realizes just how proud Ireland is of him, Mescal endearingly replied: \"I've said this many, many times, but I feel incredibly proud to be Irish.\n\n\"Like you said, going from sausage ads to this, wasn't in the bingo cards for me.\n\n\"Me and Andrew Scott both spoke about this, coming home to do the 'All of Us Strangers' premiere last year - I think I'm absolutely biased - but we've got the most extraordinary country and people who are deeply supportive of the artists that we have.\n\n\"We're kind of, as a country, punching far above our weight in terms of the output, and long may it continue and it should be supported because we've got immense talent for such a small country.\n\n\"I definitely feel an overwhelming sense of support from people back home and I can't wait to take the film there.\"", "source": {"uri": "irishcentral.com", "dataType": "news", "title": "Irish Central"}, {"uri": "2024-07-415182956", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-07-08", "time": "14:27:12", "dateTime": "2024-07-08T14:27:12Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-07-08T14:02:11Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.7098039388656616, "url": "https://clutchpoints.com/gladiator-2-paul-mescal-poster", "title": "Gladiator 2 poster shows battered Paul Mescal", "body": "The first Gladiator 2 poster was unveiled and shows Mescal's Lucius Verus on one knee in the arena. His sword is planted in the ground as Lucius rubs sand between his hands. Clearly, he is in the midst of the battle, but fans will have to wait to see who he is fighting.\n\nParamount also announced that the first trailer for the movie will drop on Tuesday, July 9. This will offer the first official glimpses of the movie's action.\n\nAdditionally, official stills were shared. They are the same ones seen in Vanity Fair's cover story on the upcoming sequel. The marketing and promotion for the movie are just getting started over four months out from release.\n\nWhat is Gladiator 2 about?\n\nGladiator 2 picks up decades after the events of the first movie. Lucius is the grandson of Marcus Aurelius (Richard Harris) and the son of Lucilla (Connie Nielson). After being forced into slavery, he fights his way out and is opposed by co-emperors Caracalla (Joseph Quinn) and Geta (Fred Hechinger).\n\nWhile Oscar-nominated actor Paul Mescal leads the Gladiator 2 cast, the ensemble is star-studded. Denzel Washington, Pedro Pascal, Joseph Quinn, Fred Hechinger, and May Calamawy will also star in the movie. Returning from the first one are Connie Nielsen and Derek Jacobi.\n\nRidley Scott directed the movie based on a script from David Scarpa. Paramount will release the movie in time for the Thanksgiving holiday on November 22, 2024.\n\nWhile Scott is 86 years old, he has not stopped making movies. He first gained notoriety for directing Alien, Blade Runner, Legend, and Thelma and Louise. Since 2014, he has made eight movies including Gladiator 2.\n\nGladiator 2 has big shoes to fill -- the first movie was a huge hit. It made over $460 million worldwide during its theatrical run on a $103 million budget.\n\nIt was also a major player at the Oscars. Gladiator was nominated for 12 Oscars and won five awards, including Best Picture and Best Actor for Russell Crowe.\n\nWho is Paul Mescal?\n\nPaul Mescal is an Oscar-nominated actor for his performance in Aftersun. He first gained notoriety for starring in the miniseries Normal People with Daisy Edgar-Jones. In the series, the two navigate adulthood during their final days of college.\n\nFor that performance, Mescal received an Emmy nomination and won a BAFTA TV Award. He subsequently starred in another miniseries, The Deceived, in 2020.\n\nOn the big screen, Mescal made his debut in Maggie Gyllenhaal's The Lost Daughter. He had a small role in the movie, which also featured Olivia Colman, Dakota Johnson, and Jessie Buckley. Mescal followed that up with roles in God's Creatures, Aftersun, and Carmen.\n\nHe starred as a single dad in Charlotte Wells' Aftersun alongside newcomer Frankie Corio. For the performance, Mescal landed a Best Actor Oscar nomination but ultimately lost to Brendan Fraser for his performance in The Whale.\n\n2023 was another big year for Mescal. He starred in All of Us Strangers with Adam Scott and then Foe with Saoirse Ronan. Because this is what they believe in... power.\" Yes it is time. Paramount Pictures has finally unveiled the first official trailer for Ridley Scott's Gladiator II, his long-awaited sequel to the Oscar-winning classic Gladiator from 2000. This legacy sequel is actually a direct sequel to the original - following Lucius, the son of Maximus's love Lucilla, after Maximus's death, who ends up fighting in the Colosseum as well. This looks like a properly glorious sequel - even bigger (and hopefully better) with battles galore, involving water and a rhino and so much more. Starring Paul Mescal as Lucius (played by Spencer Treat Clark in the first movie), Denzel Washington as Macrinus, Pedro Pascal as the Emperoro Marcus Acacius, Connie Nielsen as Lucilla, plus Joseph Quinn, Fred Hechinger, Lior Raz, Peter Mensah, and Derek Jacobi. Even after a 24 year wait for this sequel, it does look like it might be as entertaining as the original - though I doubt it'll end up winning any Oscars. Only time will tell if it shall conquer! All this footage kicks ass - especially every scene with Denzel. Fire it up below and enjoy the show.\n\nDecades after the events of Gladiator, Lucius -- the grandson of Rome's former emperor Marcus Aurelius & son of Lucilla -- lives with his wife and child in Numidia. Roman soldiers led by general Marcus Acacius invade, forcing Lucius into slavery. Inspired by Maximus, Lucius will fight as a gladiator while opposing the rule of the young emperors Caracalla and Geta. Gladiator II is once again directed by acclaimed British filmmaker Ridley Scott, director of many amazing movies including Alien, Prometheus, Alien: Covenant, The Martian, Gladiator, Robin Hood, American Gangster, The Counselor, Matchstick Men, Blade Runner, Black Hawk Down, Kingdom of Heaven, Legend, Exodus: Gods and Kings, All the Money in the World, The Last Duel, House of Gucci, and Napoleon previously. The screenplay is written by David Scarpa; based on characters created by David Franzoni, John Logan, William Nicholson. Produced by Ridley Scott, Michael Pruss, Douglas Wick, Lucy Fisher, Walter F. Parkes, Laurie MacDonald, David Franzoni. Made by Scott Free Productions, Red Wagon Entertainment, P+M Image Nation. Paramount will debut Scott's Gladiator 2 in theaters nationwide starting on November 22nd, 2024 this fall, just before Thanksgiving. {"uri": "2024-07-414892904", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-07-08", "time": "10:23:11", "dateTime": "2024-07-08T10:23:11Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-07-08T00:00:00Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.7098039388656616, "url": "https://www.techadvisor.com/article/2388236/when-do-tickets-for-gladiator-2-go-on-sale.html", "title": "When do tickets for Gladiator 2 go on sale?", "body": "Ridley Scott's bloody drama set in the heart of the Roman Empire is considered one of the greatest takes on the ancient world. While Gladiator may play fast and loose with historical facts, it offers a heart-breaking story, bigger-than-life characters, and a genuinely captivating spectacle (something Scott's Napoleon movie failed to achieve).\n\nNearly twenty-five years after the film premiere, Scott will take viewers back to the sandy arenas of Rome. In Gladiator 2, we won't see Russell Crowe or Joaquin Phoenix, stars of the original film. But don't worry - they have worthy successors.\n\nPaul Mescal will play Lucius, now grown-up nephew of Emperor Commodus from the original Gladiator. He will be accompanied by Pedro Pascal as General Marcus Acacius, Joseph Quinn as Emperor Geta, Fred Hechinger as Emperor Caracalla and Denzel Washington as Macrinus. Connie Nielsen will return as Lucius' mother, Lucilla, while Derek Jacobi will again play Senator Gracchus.\n\nThanks to the first photos published by Vanity Fair, you can get a sneak peek of the upcoming film:\n\nIf you want to know when to book tickets for the film, keep on reading.\n\nThe new Ridley Scott movie will premiere in the UK on Friday, 15 November 2024. The long-awaited film is already creating quite a buzz, so the tickets will likely be available for booking at least a month before the opening day.\n\nUS\n\nGladiator 2 will debut in the US on Friday, 22 November 2024. It will be one of the biggest premieres this fall, but not the only one. The movie will compete fiercely with Wicked, which will debut in cinemas on the same day.\n\nAccording to Vanity Fair, it can create a situation similar to the Barbenheimer case when the same release date for Barbie and Oppenheimer pumps up the hype for both movies.\n\nWithout fail, the creators of the Gladiator 2 want to gain as much advantage as they can over their rivals. Thus, the tickets for Ridley Scott's movie will probably go on sale several weeks before the film's release.\n\nTickets will be available from all the major cinema chains in the US and UK:", "source": {"uri": "8217401262", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-07-09", "time": "17:33:27", "dateTime": "2024-07-09T17:33:27Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-07-09T17:32:24Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.7058823704719543, "url": "https://www.destructoid.com/gladiator-2-gets-an-official-trailer-full-of-blood-and-spectacle/", "title": "Gladiator 2 gets an official trailer full of blood and spectacle", "body": "Paramount pictures' YouTube channel has just released the trailer for Gladiator 2, the long-awaited and somewhat puzzling sequel for the '00 Best Picture Academy Award winner starring Russell Crowe and directed by Ridley Scott.\n\nGladiator 2 stars Paul Mescal, Pedro Pascal, and Denzel Washington, and looks to be set after the events of the first film, with some references for fans of the original.\n\nThe first thing to catch my eye in the trailer is the beautiful balance struck between the gritty reality of the arenas and the decadent ostentation of the ruling class. Much like the original film, Gladiator 2 seems to have put a lot of effort and money into building huge sets to make it all feel as real as possible instead of just going with a huge CGI arena. That's all great, but one question remains: what is this movie even going to be about?\n\nAs you likely know by now, and without venturing into spoiler territory, the original Gladiator tells the beginning middle and end of a story, not leaving much room for a direct sequel. So, Gladiator 2 will take place a few decades after the original and follow Lucius, the now-grown son of the Emperor's sister who was Maximus' fan in the first film.\n\nAs revealed in a Vanity Fair piece, we know that Paul Mescal's Lucius departed Rome shortly after the events of the first film. He was living a calm life away from the troubles and venom of Roman nobility until he got captured by Pedro Pascal's Marcus Acacius, a new Roman general who used to serve under Maximus and who's unaware that he's capturing his wife's son. After his capture, Lucius will naturally end up fending for himself in wilder-than-ever gladiatorial arenas, and Denzel Washington will likely play a role similar to that of Oliver Reed's Proximo, Maximus' owner/manager in the first movie.\n\nThough the main conflict seems to revolve around the first two, they will also have to deal with Joseph Quinn and Fred Hechinger, who'll be playing a duo of new evil Emperor siblings that the trailer effortlessly sells as detestable, like Joaquin Phoenix's Commodus from the original. Everyone will be joined by Connie Nielsen reprising her role as Lucilla, the mother of Lucius.\n\nGladiator 2 is set to release on November 22. We get a good look at Pedro Pascal as Marcus Acacius, too, and the Colosseum in all its glory. There's plenty of action, too, with large-scale battles and arena fights. The trailer teases a fight between Lucius and a gladiator riding a rhino, and Marcus Acacius taking on a handful of enemies on his own. It ends with a fight between Lucius and Marcus Acacius, with Rome the setting of an uprising.\n\nIt's the most substantial look we've gotten at the long-awaited sequel, following a batch of photos that debuted in Vanity Fair earlier this month. Prior to that, only attendees of CinemaCon got a peek at a few minutes of action-packed footage behind closed doors in April (read IGN's breakdown of the footage here).\n\nGladiator 2 features a star-studded new cast including Paul Mescal as Lucius Verus, Pedro Pascal as Marcus Acacius, Denzel Washington as Macrinus, and Joseph Quinn as Geta, with Connie Nielsen returning as Lucilla, the mother of Lucius. One star we know won't be returning, however, is the original's Russell Crowe, who's insisted that the sequel \"has nothing to do with me\" and his deceased character Maximus.\n\nGladiator 2 is set several years after the events of the first film, and will find an all-grown-up Lucius as he's forced into slavery, despite being the former heir to the Roman Empire. Not unlike Maximus, we'll see him enter hit the sandy arena as a gladiator as he opposes the rule of Caracalla (Fred Hechinger) and Geta.\n\nGladiator 2 will hit theaters on November 22 (going {"uri": "8215359907", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-07-08", "time": "13:44:02", "dateTime": "2024-07-08T13:44:02Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-07-08T13:43:45Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.7019608020782471, "url": "https://sffgazette.com/fantasy/movies/gladiator-ii-poster-highlights-paul-mescals-lucius-as-trailer-is-confirmed-for-tomorrow-a8241", "title": "GLADIATOR II Poster Highlights Paul Mescal's Lucius As Trailer Is Confirmed For Tomorrow", "body": "The first official poster for Sir Ridley Scott's Gladiator II has been released and it puts Paul Mescal's Lucius front and centre as he steps into the arena like Maximus before him. Check it out here...\n\nThe first poster for Gladiator II has been released and with that comes confirmation a trailer is set to follow tomorrow. While a handful of stills recently offered a sneak peek at what's to come, fans of Sir Ridley Scott's 2000 classic have been eager to see footage for some time now.\n\nThe sequel centres around Paul Mescal's Lucius, the son of Connie Nielsen's Lucilla. Decades have passed and he's come of age far away from his mother after she sent him to the northern coast of Africa to escape the reaches of the Roman Empire.\n\nHe's grown up resenting his mother (not understanding she had good reason for sending him away) but now has a peaceful life with a wife and child of his own...until the Romans invade. As a result, he soon finds himself competing in the arena we once saw Maximus fight in.\n\nMescal's breakthrough performance was in Normal People; however, Gladiator II will likely be the movie that puts him on the map.\n\nDuring a recent interview, he reflected on first meeting with Scott. \"We spoke for about 20 to 30 minutes. I wanted to get a flavor from him about what the story was going to be about, so we spent about 15 minutes talking about that, and then we spent another 10 minutes talking about the sport that I played growing up - Gaelic football.\"\n\n\"Maybe that was something that helped with it, in that I'm used to being physical in my body. My memory of it is that probably two or three weeks later, the offer came in.\"\n\nAs for his physical transformation, Mescal said, \"I just wanted to be big and strong and look like somebody who can cause a bit of damage when shit hits the fan. I think also, sometimes, one could, in striving for that perfect look, end up looking more like an underwear model than a warrior.\"\n\n\"Muscles start to grow, and that can be deemed aesthetic in certain capacities, but there is something about feeling strong in your body that elicits just a different feeling,\" the actor continued. \"You carry yourself differently. It has an impact on you psychologically in a way that is useful for the film.\"\n\nBased on characters by David Franzoni and a story by Peter Craig and David Scarpa, Ridley Scott directs Gladiator II from a script by Scarpa. The promo comes following yesterday's poster debut and boy does this look good.\n\nThe film is obviously the follow-up to Rodney Scott's Oscar-winning Gladiator which was released all of the way back in 2000. Gladiator II comes to cinema screens through Paramount Pictures and is produced by Douglas Wick, Ridley Scott, Lucy Fisher, Michael Pruss, and David Franzoni. David Scarpa wrote the screenplay based on characters created by David Franzoni. The story is by Peter Craig and David Scarpa.\n\nNo Russell Crowe this time around, but Paul Mescal, Pedro Pascal, Joseph Quinn, Fred Hechinger, Lior Raz, Derek Jacobi, Connie Nielsen and Denzel Washington line up among the impressive cast.\n\nGladiator, the striking original led by Crowe garnered no less than five Oscar wins, including one for its main actor. It also scored Best Picture as well as taking $465.4 million worldwide during its run. That movie had a reported budget of around $103 million but this new one is considerably more.\n\nThe new one (as per the IMDB) follows Lucius (played by Mescal), the son of Maximus's love Lucilla, after Maximus's death.\n\nFilming has taken place in the UK, Morocco, Malta (where the first movie was shot) and most recently at South Downs at Devil's Dyke, Sussex. Mescal was spotted on set filming scenes for the movie.\n\nFootage from the film was screened at CinemaCon in Las Vegas earlier this year with the crowds lapping up what was on display. Around five minutes of scenes, albeit reportedly unfinished, were screened at the event at Caesar's Palace in the city.\n\nThe first Gladiator II trailer can be viewed below. The film will be released in cinemas on 15th November and we, among millions of others around the world, are expecting big things. The film will see grown-up Lucius returning to Rome as a gladiator, where he makes new enemies and reunites with his mother.\n\nAlongside Paul Mescal in the role of Lucius, The Last of Us' Pedro Pascal has also been cast as Marcus Acacius, a Roman general who trained under Maximus. Meanwhile, Denzel Washington plays Macrinus, a \"power broker\" who keeps a stable of gladiators.\n\nRounding out the cast will be Connie Nielsen, who is reprising her role as Lucius' mother Lucilla. Stranger Things actor Joseph Quinn will play Emperor Caracalla, while Saltburn's Barry Keoghan will portray Emperor Gata.\n\nFollowing the trailer's release, many fans have been taking to social media to express their thoughts so far.\n\n\"This is going to be the movie of the year!!\" one fan commented on Instagram.\n\n\"Omg!!! {"uri": "8213320447", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-07-07", "time": "03:58:11", "dateTime": "2024-07-07T03:58:11Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-07-07T03:57:10Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.6980392336845398, "url": "https://movieweb.com/gladiator-2-ridley-scott-cast-paul-mescal-after-watching-normal-people/", "title": "Ridley Scott Cast Paul Mescal in Gladiator II After Watching This Romantic TV Show", "body": "Summary Paul Mescal's role in the romantic drama miniseries Normal People caught Ridley Scott's eye, and he invited the actor to star in Gladiator II . Mescal's love of sport and physicality from his past helped him in the role, but Scott knew he was right for it almost immediately. Co-star Pedro Pascal nicknamed Mescal \"Brick Wall Paul\" due to his strength, saying that he dreaded fight scenes with him.\n\nPaul Mescal is known for appearing in emotional, heartbreaking roles, and it was one of his earliest hits that led Ridley Scott to cast him in the upcoming Gladiator II. Mescal has had an amazing last few years, appearing in Charlotte Wells' devastating Aftersun, and Andrew Haigh's mind-bending and heart-tugging All of Us Strangers. But before appearing in those critically acclaimed movies, Mescal co-starred with Daisy Edgar-Jones in the miniseries Normal People, based on the novel by Sally Rooney.\n\nSurprisingly, it was that role as an anxious young adult struggling with life and love in Ireland that helped Mescal become the new face of 2024's biggest action movie. Speaking to Vanity Fair, director Ridley Scott revealed how he discovered Mescal's acting talents. The director said that he's always hunting for new talent whenever he's watching a new movie or TV show. The BBC Three and Hulu adaptation of Sally Rooney's best-selling novel is a far cry from the sword and sandals, blood-flowing spectacles of the Roman Colosseum, but Scott knew he'd found his leading man when watching the series. The director said:\n\n\"When I watch anything, I tend to be clocking who's interesting. It's just in my DNA. And so, watching a TV show that's not really my kind of TV show, almost four years ago, I said, 'Who's this guy?' I met with him, and he said, 'Of course, I'd love to do it.' And that was it. We were away and running with the ball. He was a special find. He was absolutely perfect .\"\n\n1 Image 1 Image Close Gladiator II DramaActionAdventure Release Date November 22, 2024 Director Ridley Scott Cast Pedro Pascal , Connie Nielsen , Denzel Washington , Paul Mescal , Joseph Quinn , Djimon Hounsou Main Genre Action Paul Mescal's Love of Sport Helped Him Land the Role in Gladiator 2 Close\n\nMaking the move from Mescal's romantic, emotional roles to a major franchise meant that the actor had to transform his body to convincingly play a Roman gladiator. But physicality isn't anything new for Mescal. Mescal added to Ridley Scott's story of how he was cast, and revealed that his love of sport as a child and teenager helped him land the role of a violent warrior. The actor also revealed that he wasn't required to camera test for the role, as Ridley Scott had already decided he was the actor for the role. Mescal said:\n\n\" We spoke for about 20 to 30 minutes . I wanted to get a flavor from him about what the story was going to be about, so we spent about 15 minutes talking about that, and then we spent another 10 minutes talking about the sport that I played growing up -- Gaelic football. Maybe that was something that helped with it, in that I'm used to being physical in my body . My memory of it is that probably two or three weeks later, the offer came in.\"\n\nRelated Wickedator Weekend is on, Wicked Gets Earlier Release Date in Direct Competition With Gladiator 2\n\nWicked has avoided a direct challenge from Moana 2, but instead sets up this year's Barbenheimer double-header.\n\nMescal gained so much muscle and strength for the role that his co-star, Pedro Pascal, bestowed him with a new nickname, \"Brick Wall Paul.\" Aided by his background in Gaelic Football -- an Irish blend of soccer and rugby -- Paul Mescal frightened Pascal during their fight scenes. Pascal explained:\n\nIt's brutal, man. I call him Brick Wall Paul. He got so strong. I would rather be thrown from a building than have to fight him again.\n\nThat means it should be exhilarating to see. Set two decades post the Russell Crowe-starrer 'Gladiator,' the film marks a significant leap in both time and storyline.\n\nMescal, 28, expressed his excitement about the project, \"I'm thrilled to present the first trailer of 'Gladiator II.' {"uri": "8217262099", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-07-09", "time": "15:49:34", "dateTime": "2024-07-09T15:49:34Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-07-09T15:49:21Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.6901960968971252, "url": "https://www.pajiba.com/film_reviews/the-new-trailer-for-gladiator-ii-starring-denzel-washington-and-paul-mescal-is-here.php", "title": "The New Trailer For 'Gladiator II' Starring Denzel Washington and Paul Mescal Is Here", "body": "In the year 2000 (and I can never say or write that sentence without thinking of Late Night with Conan O'Brien), Gladiator opened in theaters. It was directed by Ridley Scott, and starred Russell Crowe, Joaquin Phoenix, Connie Nielsen, Djimon Hounsou, the late Richard Harris, and Oliver Reed in his final performance before he died in 1999. The film made $465 million worldwide, won five Oscars (including Best Actor for Crowe and Best Picture), and became an obsession for Ralph Cifaretto on The Sopranos before he was beaten and strangled to death in his own kitchen by Tony Soprano. (A not-entirely-fun fact: Gladiator was the first movie I ever bought on DVD, along with my very first DVD player. Rest in peace, Circuit City.)\n\nTwenty-four years later, its long-awaited sequel is about to open in theaters (and on the same day as Wicked: Part One, no less), with the trailer for Gladiator II premiering online earlier today, and Ridley Scott back in the director's chair.\n\nOver two decades after the events of Gladiator, Lucius -- the grandson of Rome's former emperor Marcus Aurelius (Harris) and son of Lucilla (Nielsen) -- lives with his wife and child in Numidia. Roman soldiers led by general Marcus Acacius (played by Pedro Pascal) invade, forcing Lucius into slavery. Inspired by the story of Maximus, as depicted in the original 2000 film, Lucius (played by Paul Mescal) resolves to fight as a gladiator while opposing the rule of the young emperors Caracalla and Geta (played by Fred Hechinger and Joseph Quinn).\n\nGladiator II, starring Paul Mescal, Pedro Pascal, Connie Nielsen, and Denzel Washington, opens in theaters on November 22. {"uri": "8217374802", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-07-09", "time": "17:11:12", "dateTime": "2024-07-09T17:11:12Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-07-09T17:10:44Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.6901960968971252, "url": "https://www.inverse.com/entertainment/gladiator-2-trailer", "title": "24 Years Later, 'Gladiator II' Could Break a Tedious Hollywood Curse", "body": "Gladiator was one of the best historical epics ever, but a large part of its appeal came from its no-frills, straightforward revenge story. In an age where revenge pics were a dime a dozen, Ridley Scott's 2000 masterpiece made a familiar premise feel visceral and real again. It helped that Scott was also taking a gutsier approach to the sword-and-sandals films that once dominated the multiplex. In many ways, Gladiator represented the genre's peak, and it still hasn't really been topped. But leave it to Scott, 24 years later, to take a swing at a follow-up.\n\n\"Legacyquels\" have become a staple of modern Hollywood, so it was only a matter of time before someone tried to build on the world of Gladiator. Hopefully, with Scott at the helm, Gladiator II won't be just another empty cash grab. There are loose connections to the original film starring Russell Crowe, along with a few returning cast members, and it also echos Gladiator's tale of vengeance and redemption. But with fresh blood in the form of Paul Mescal, Pedro Pascal, Denzel Washington, and Joseph Quinn, Gladiator II could provide a refreshingly modern take on the classic genre.\n\nAppropriately set a few decades after Gladiator, Gladiator II tells the story of Lucius (Mescal), a warrior who shapes himself into an instrument of revenge. He's the son of the Roman noblewoman Lucilla (Connie Nielsen, reprising her original role), and he might also be the son of Crowe's Maximus. No one knows for sure, especially since he grew up miles away from the Roman empire and built a life for himself in relative peace. But in an echo of the original Gladiator, that's quickly thwarted by an attack from Roman forces.\n\nLucius becomes a prisoner, then a gladiator determined to tear down the system that destroyed his life. With the help of a charming power broker (Washington), Lucius will challenge the Roman general (Pascal) who led the invasion of his hometown. Before we get that epic showdown, however, Lucius has to survive wild rhinos, a simulated sea battle in the Colosseum, and a potential reunion with his estranged mom. Heads will roll, swords will swing, and fate will be tested. Gladiator II doesn't seem to be reinventing the wheel, but maybe a return to form is just what audiences need right now.", "source": {"uri": "inverse.com", "dataType": "news", "title": "Inverse"}, Paul Mescal (Normal People; Aftersun; The Lost Daughter) stars as Lucius, squaring off against 3x Primetime Emmy-nominee Pedro Pascal (The Mandalorian; Game of Thrones; Narcos) and Academy Award-winner Denzel Washington (Training Day; Fences; Malcolm X).\n\nAs per the official synopsis, \"Gladiator II continues the epic saga of power, intrigue, and vengeance set in Ancient Rome. Years after witnessing the death of the revered hero Maximus at the hands of his uncle, Lucius (Paul Mescal) is forced to enter the Colosseum after his home is conquered by the tyrannical Emperors who now lead Rome with an iron fist. With rage in his heart and the future of the Empire at stake, Lucius must look to his past to find strength and honor to return the glory of Rome to its people.\"\n\nRidley Scott returns to direct this highly anticipated sequel to his blockbuster film Gladiator, which starred Russell Crowe as Maximus Decimus Meridius and Joaquin Phoenix as Commodus. The original Gladiator, released in 2000, grossed over $465.4 million globally on a production budget of approximately $100 million. It won five Academy Awards, including Best Picture, and is frequently regarded as one of the greatest movies ever made. Given this legacy, the sequel certainly has high expectations to meet.\n\nIn addition to the lead roles by Mescal, Pascal, and Washington, the supporting cast is equally star-studded. Connie Nielsen (Wonder Woman; Gladiator; The Devil's Advocate) reprises her role as Lucilla. Other notable cast members include Joseph Quinn (Stranger Things; Catherine the Great; Overlord), Fred Hechinger (The White Lotus; Fear Street Part One: 1994; News of the World), Derek Jacobi (I, Claudius; Gladiator; The King's Speech), Tim McInnerny (Blackadder; Notting Hill; Eddie the Eagle), Alexander Karim (Tyrant; The Lawyer; Zero Dark Thirty), Lior Raz (Fauda; 6 Underground; Mary Magdalene), Peter Mensah (300; Avatar; Spartacus: Blood and Sand), Matt Lucas (Little Britain; Bridesmaids; Alice in Wonderland), and May Calamawy (Ramy; Moon Knight; The Long Road Home).\n\nThe trailer showcases the grand scale of the film, with epic battles, stunning visuals, and intense performances from the cast. Ridley Scott's return to this universe is highly anticipated, as he brings his unique vision and storytelling prowess back to the gladiatorial arenas of Ancient Rome.\n\nFans of the original film and newcomers alike will be eagerly awaiting the release of Gladiator II, which promises to deliver a compelling and visually spectacular continuation of the saga. Paul Mescal (Normal People; Aftersun; The Lost Daughter) takes on the role of Lucius, going head-to-head with 3x Primetime Emmy-nominee Pedro Pascal (The Mandalorian; Game of Thrones; Narcos) and Academy Award-winner Denzel Washington (Training Day; Fences; Malcolm X).\n\nAccording to the official synopsis, \"Gladiator II continues the epic saga of power, intrigue, and vengeance set in Ancient Rome. Years after witnessing the death of the revered hero Maximus at the hands of his uncle, Lucius (Paul Mescal) is forced to enter the Colosseum after his home is conquered by the tyrannical Emperors who now lead Rome with an iron fist. With rage in his heart and the future of the Empire at stake, Lucius must look to his past to find strength and honor to return the glory of Rome to its people.\"\n\nRidley Scott returns to direct this eagerly awaited sequel to his blockbuster film Gladiator, which starred Russell Crowe as Maximus Decimus Meridius and Joaquin Phoenix as Commodus. The original Gladiator, released in 2000, grossed over $465.4 million globally on a production budget of around $100 million. It won five Academy Awards, including Best Picture, and is often regarded as one of the greatest movies ever made. With such a legacy, the sequel has high expectations to meet.\n\nBesides the leading performances by Mescal, Pascal, and Washington, the supporting cast is equally impressive. Connie Nielsen (Wonder Woman; Gladiator; The Devil's Advocate) reprises her role as Lucilla. Other notable cast members include Joseph Quinn (Stranger Things; Catherine the Great; Overlord), Fred Hechinger (The White Lotus; Fear Street Part One: 1994; News of the World), Derek Jacobi (I, Claudius; Gladiator; The King's Speech), Tim McInnerny (Blackadder; Notting Hill; Eddie the Eagle), Alexander Karim (Tyrant; The Lawyer; Zero Dark Thirty), Lior Raz (Fauda; 6 Underground; Mary Magdalene), Peter Mensah (300; Avatar; Spartacus: Blood and Sand), Matt Lucas (Little Britain; Bridesmaids; Alice in Wonderland), and May Calamawy (Ramy; Moon Knight; The Long Road Home).\n\nThe trailer highlights the grand scale of the film, featuring epic battles, stunning visuals, and intense performances from the cast. Ridley Scott's return to this universe is highly anticipated, as he brings his unique vision and storytelling prowess back to the gladiatorial arenas of Ancient Rome.\n\nBoth fans of the original film and new viewers are eagerly awaiting the release of Gladiator II, which promises to deliver a compelling and visually spectacular continuation of the saga. {"uri": "2024-07-413550451", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-07-06", "time": "18:20:08", "dateTime": "2024-07-06T18:20:08Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-07-06T18:18:12Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.686274528503418, "url": "https://collider.com/movie-news-july-2024-6/", "title": "Witches vs. Gladiators, and All the Big Movie News You Missed This Week", "body": "This week came in hot with the first stills from Gladiator II, finally giving fans of the 2000 movie a treat after a long wait. 24 years after the original premiered, the upcoming sequel is filled with a star-studded cast, and a brand-new warrior to root for in the bloody battles set to happen in the Colosseum. In addition to the film's first images, another headline made musical lovers even more pumped to know that Wicked will arrive on the big screen a few days earlier. Other major news stories that came out include updates on Now You See Me 3, as well as potential guest appearances from the newly-appointed Fantastic Four at an upcoming event. To keep you in the loop on what is happening in the film world, here is a detailed breakdown of all the big announcements that came out this week.\n\nMonday\n\n'Gladiator II' First Images Take Paul Mescal to the Colosseum\n\nAfter much anticipation, Vanity Fair gave a generous first look at Gladiator II early this week. The outlet shared several images of the main cast at the Colosseum, including a shot featuring an intense sword fight between Paul Mescal and Pedro Pascal. The Normal People alum will be the main warrior in the upcoming sequel, playing Commodus' nephew Lucius. Other cast members who are also part of the ensemble include Denzel Washington, Joseph Quinn, and Connie Nielsen. According to Ridley Scott, the film's identity will be shaped by the OG installment's legacy, honoring Maximus (Russell Crowe) 20 years after his tragic death. As reported last month, Gladiator II will be arriving internationally on November 15 and in North America on November 22.\n\nRelated\n\nPaul Mescal and Pedro Pascal Clash in First 'Gladiator II' Images\n\nPaul Mescal and Pedro Pascal are sweaty and bloody in the first images from Ridley Scott's highly-anticipated sequel.\n\n'Wicked' and 'Gladiator II' Hope To Spark a New Barbenheimer This November\n\nClose\n\nA surprise announcement about Wicked's theatrical premiere was made this week, informing us that it would arrive sooner than expected. Originally set to come out on November 27 (alongside Moana 2), the movie's release date changed to November 22, becoming the main competitor to Gladiator II at the box office. Several people believe that these two titles arriving on the big screen on the same day could lead to another \"Barbenheimer\" moment, with fans lining up to watch one or the other (or even both). The film based on the beloved Broadway musical is directed by Jon M. Chu (responsible for In the Heights and Crazy Rich Asians) and has Ariana Grande and Cynthia Erivo playing Galenda and Elphaba, two very different witches who are close at first but have a major fallout when one of them takes a dark turn.\n\nRelated\n\n'Wicked' Gets in the Arena With 'Gladiator II' With New Release Date\n\nAre you not entertained?\n\n'The Fantastic Four' In Talks to Make Guest Appearance at the San Diego Comic-Con\n\nAfter SDCC posters surfaced online showing Pedro Pascal and Joseph Quinn as Mr. Fantastic and Human Torch, it is very probable that The Fantastic Four cast might be making their official debut at the event. The reboot will commence filming on July 29, a day after San Diego Comic-Con is over, meaning that the likelihood of the actors making a quick stop at the convention is big. The news about the cast's attendance hasn't been confirmed yet, but there are high chances that Marvel Studios president Kevin Feige might introduce them as the new faces taking on the beloved comic book superheroes. In addition to Pascal and Quinn, Vanessa Kirby and Ebon Moss-Bachrach will play Invisible Woman and The Thing.\n\nRelated\n\nAre The Fantastic Four Coming to San Diego Comic Con?\n\nSDCC 2024 begins on July 25.\n\nTi West Is Open to Expand 'X' Franchise After 'Maxxxine'\n\nAlthough Maxxxine has been marketed as the final chapter of the X franchise, Ti West is still pondering whether to make more sequels and spinoffs related to the horror trilogy. In a recent interview with Collider's own Perri Nemiroff, the director brought fans hope by hinting that Maxine (played by Mia Goth) hasn't finished her spree yet. When asked about the promo for the film alluding to the end of the franchise, West simply responded that he \"didn't make the trailers\", which clearly shows he is still very optimistic about continuing to venture into this universe. When adding the finishing touches to the third installment, he discussed that he already has an idea for another film if number 3 has a positive reception:\n\n\" There is this one weird idea that I have that is kind of ... if I explained it, it would make sense. But we'll see what happens. Let's get this movie done first, see if people like it. Then we'll go from there.\"\n\nIn her interview with Nemiroff, Maxxxine star Lily Collins also expressed her desire to go back on set for a fourth movie, which is also assuring.\n\nRelated\n\nThe 'MaXXXine' Trailers Have Lied to You -- Ti West Is Still Game for a Fourth Film\n\nThe filmmaker may not be done with Mia Goth's titular slasher just yet.\n\nTuesday\n\n'Now You See Me 3' Coming Out Next Year With Even More Magic Tricks\n\nThe Four Horsemen have a lot more tricks up their sleeves, and Now You See Me 3 will see them orchestrating another heist-meets-illusion show. Lionsgate announced this week that the film is expected to arrive in theaters on November 14, 2025. Although plot details are currently under wraps, it has already been confirmed that Jesse Eisenberg, Isla Fisher, Woody Harrelson, Dave Franco, and Morgan Freeman will all be back for the upcoming sequel. In addition to the returning cast, the third installment will also introduce a new group of magicians, with Justice Smith, Dominic Sessa, Ariana Greenblatt, and Rosamund Pike playing them onscreen.\n\nRelated\n\n'Now You See Me 3' Just Got a Massive Update\n\nJesse Eisenberg is set to return for the threequel next year.\n\nWednesday\n\nPeter Jackson Finally Revealed What 'Lord of the Rings: The Hunt for Gollum' Is About\n\nAfter The Lord of the Rings trilogy garnered a massive following over the years, Peter Jackson is returning to the franchise as the producer of the upcoming prequel The Hunt of Gollum. This week, the renowned filmmaker gave further insight into what fans can expect from the movie, sharing that it will be less about epic battles and more about understanding Gollum's mind. The project will serve as an origin story for the character, and it will further examine the differences between him and Sm\u00e9agol. Here is what he had to say about the plot:\n\n\"The Gollum/Sm\u00e9agol character has always fascinated me because Gollum reflects the worst of human nature, whilst his Sm\u00e9agol side is, arguably, quite sympathetic. I think he connects with readers and film audiences alike, because there's a little bit of both of them in all of us. We really want to explore his backstory and delve into those parts of his journey we didn't have time to cover in the earlier films. It's too soon to know who will cross his path, but suffice to say we will take our lead from Professor Tolkien.\"\n\nRelated\n\nPeter Jackson Reveals Major Plot Details For 'The Lord of the Rings: The Hunt For Gollum'\n\n\"I think he connects with readers and film audiences alike.\"\n\nThursday\n\n'Avatar 4' Begins Shooting and Sets Release Date For Years From Now\n\nJames Cameron is adding another sequel to the Avatar franchise, and although it is only coming out in 2029 (yes, a few years from now), it is exciting to know that the film has begun shooting. The update was shared by Joel David Moore through his Instagram handle. The actor who plays Norm Spellman in the sci-fi franchise said in the post's caption that he is back in New Zealand and that being in the country feels nostalgic to him since he has been heading there for the past 17 years working on the Avatar films. In an interview with Collider, Zoe Salda\u00f1a also expressed her enthusiasm to work alongside Cameron in the upcoming installment, stating that the director never ceases to blow her mind.\n\nRelated\n\n'Avatar 4' Star Shares an Exciting Filming Update\n\nThe sequel is currently slated to premiere in December 2029.", "source": {"uri": "collider.com", "dataType": "news", "title": {"uri": "8215320597", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-07-08", "time": "13:17:40", "dateTime": "2024-07-08T13:17:40Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-07-08T13:17:20Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.6823529601097107, "url": "https://www.indiewire.com/news/breaking-news/gladiator-2-first-look-paul-mescal-ridley-scott-roman-empire-1235021886/", "title": "'Gladiator II' First Look: Paul Mescal Returns to the Roman Empire in Ridley Scott's Epic Sequel", "body": "Mescal leads Ridley Scott's highly-anticipated epic sequel, with the actor playing Lucius, the nephew of since-deceased Commodus (Joaquin Phoenix) who was killed by Russell Crowe's Maximus. \"Gladiator 2\" is set 20 years after the events of the first film, with the estimated era for the sequel being 200 A.D.\n\nMescal's Lucius is the son of Lucilla (Connie Nielsen) and grandson of Marcus Aurelius, and originally played by Spencer Treat Clark in the 2000 feature. The character idolized Maximus. Oscar winner Crowe who played the character confirmed he is not part of the sequel since Maximus died in the original movie.\n\n\"Stranger Things\" star Joseph Quinn plays the new Caesar deciding the fate of the warriors, while Pedro Pascal is a general and Denzel Washington is a power broker. A teaser of the film's footage screened at CinemaCon. Mescal was shown as a slave battling primates in games inside the Colosseum. Mescal also goes up against Pascal onscreen.\n\nMescal, who previously admitted that he was \"stressed\" about leading the sequel, recently told Vanity Fair that the feature really is about the lengths society will go to to be immortal.\n\n\"What human beings will do to survive, but also what human beings will do to win,\" Mescal said. \"We see that in the arena, but also in the political struggle that's going on outside of my character's storyline, where you see there's other characters striving and pulling for power. Where's the space for humanity? Where's the space for love, familial connection? And ultimately, will those things overcome this kind of greed and power? Those things are oftentimes directly in conflict with each other.\"\n\nMescal continued of his character specifically, \"It's very 'angry young man' drama in that sense. He can see the way Rome has kind of fallen in on itself. Rome represents all the personal neglect that he felt as a child. Suddenly he's thrust back into that world and has direct proximity to all of the things that he thinks he hates and doesn't feel attached to anymore.\"\n\nScott teased that the film is \"pretty gnarly\" both in its action scenes and historical context.\n\nThe Paramount Pictures sequel is written by Scott's \"Napoleon\" screenwriter David Scarpa. Original \"Gladiator\" collaborators, costume designer Janty Yates and production designer Arthur Max, are returning along with director-producer Scott. Scott Free President Michael Pruss, plus Doug Wick and Lucy Fisher via Red Wagon Entertainment, are also producing.\n\nDirector Scott recreated the original film's sets in Malta in the exact same spot where they shot the first feature. According to actor Quinn, Scott would film with eight cameras at once for just a single scene. Quinn told IndieWire that working with auteur Scott was \"life affirming, amazing, and beyond anything I could've imagined.\"\n\n\"Gladiator 2\" premieres November 22 in theaters. Decades have passed and he's come of age far away from his mother after she sent him to the northern coast of Africa to escape the reaches of the Roman Empire.\n\nHe's grown up resenting his mother - not understanding she had good reason for sending him away - but now has a peaceful life with a wife and child of his own...until the Romans invade. As a result, he soon finds himself competing in the arena we once saw Maximus fight in.\n\nMescal's breakthrough performance was in Normal People; however, Gladiator II will likely be the movie that puts him on the map.\n\nDuring a recent interview, he reflected on first meeting with Scott. \"We spoke for about 20 to 30 minutes. I wanted to get a flavor from him about what the story was going to be about, so we spent about 15 minutes talking about that, and then we spent another 10 minutes talking about the sport that I played growing up - Gaelic football.\"\n\n\"Maybe that was something that helped with it, in that I'm used to being physical in my body. My memory of it is that probably two or three weeks later, the offer came in.\"\n\nAs for his physical transformation, Mescal said, \"I just wanted to be big and strong and look like somebody who can cause a bit of damage when shit hits the fan. {"uri": "8217041297", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-07-09", "time": "13:35:17", "dateTime": "2024-07-09T13:35:17Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-07-09T13:34:20Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.6784313917160034, "url": "https://sea.ign.com/gladiator-2/217966/news/gladiator-2s-first-trailer-teases-big-battles-arena-combat-and-a-fight-with-a-rhino", "title": "Gladiator 2's First Trailer Teases Big Battles, Arena Combat, and a Fight With a Rhino", "body": "This post might contain affiliation links. If you buy something through this post, the publisher may get a share of the sale.\n\n24 years after the original film, Paramount Pictures finally unveiled the first trailer for Ridley Scott's Gladiator 2 on Tuesday, just months ahead of its November release date.\n\nThe trailer kicks off with Paul Mescal's Lucius Verus calling back to the first film, with Denzel Washington's Macrinus pulling the strings. We get a good look at Pedro Pascal as Marcus Acacius, too, and the Colosseum in all its glory. There's plenty of action, with large-scale battles and arena fights. The trailer teases a fight between Lucius and a gladiator riding a rhino, and Marcus Acacius taking on a handful of enemies on his own. The clip ends on a fight between Lucius and Marcus Acacius, with Rome the setting of an uprising.\n\nIt's the most substantial look we've gotten at the long-awaited sequel, following a batch of photos that debuted in Vanity Fair earlier this month. Prior to that, only attendees of CinemaCon got a peek at a few minutes of action-packed footage behind closed doors in April (read IGN's breakdown of the footage here).\n\nGladiator 2 features a star-studded new cast including Paul Mescal as Lucius Verus, Pedro Pascal as Marcus Acacius, Denzel Washington as Macrinus, and Joseph Quinn as Geta, with Connie Nielsen returning as Lucilla, the mother of Lucius. One star we know won't be returning, however, is the original's Russell Crowe, who's insisted that the sequel \"has nothing to do with me\" and his deceased character Maximus.\n\nGladiator 2 is set several years after the events of the first film, and will find an all-grown-up Lucius as he's forced into slavery, despite being the former heir to the Roman Empire. Not unlike Maximus, we'll see him enter hit the sandy arena as a gladiator as he opposes the rule of Caracalla (Fred Hechinger) and Geta.\n\nGladiator 2 will hit theaters on November 22 (going head-to-head with Wicked, no less).\n\nWesley is the UK News Editor for IGN. unveiled", "body": "The action-packed trailer for the highly-anticipated Gladiator sequel starring Paul Mescal has finally been unveiled and sees the Irish actor battling a rhino and crossing swords with Pedro Pascal.\n\nThe 28-year-old Maynooth native is taking on his first major Hollywood role in the long-awaited sequel to the 2000 Oscar-winning epic starring Russell Crowe.\n\nThe epic looking Gladiator II picks up 25 years from where the first film left off and follows Mescal's Lucius, the now-grown-up son of Lucilla, played by Connie Nelson, and his fight for survival under the rule of tyrannical general Acacius (Pedro Pascal).\n\nThe new outing is set 20 years after the events of the original movie, with the estimated era for the sequel being 200 AD.\n\nA synopsis of the film reads: \"Years after witnessing the death of the revered hero Maximus at the hands of his uncle, Lucius (Paul Mescal) is forced to enter the Colosseum after his home is conquered by the tyrannical Emperors who now lead Rome with an iron fist.\n\n\"With rage in his heart and the future of the Empire at stake, Lucius must look to his past to find strength and honor to return the glory of Rome to its people.\"\n\nDenzel Washington appears in the film as the wealthy powerbroker Macrinus, while Stranger Things and A Quiet Place: Day One star Joseph Quinn and The White Lotus actor Fred Hechinger play co-emperors Caracalla and Geta.\n\nMescal recently said the training for his leading role was focused on making him look \"big and strong\" rather than \"an underwear model\".\n\nIn an interview with US publication Variety, Mescal said that his preparation for the demanding role centred around fight choreography rather than workouts designed to sculpt muscle.\n\nMeanwhile, his co-star Pedro Pascal, known for The Last Of Us and Narcos, said he referred to Mescal as \"Brick Wall Paul\" due to his physical transformation for the part.\n\n\"It's brutal, man. I call him Brick Wall Paul,\" Pascal told Variety. \"He got so strong. I would rather be thrown from a building than have to fight him again.\n\n\"To go up against somebody that fit and that talented and that much younger.... Outside of Ridley being a total genius, Paul is a big reason as to why I would put my poor body through that experience.\"\n\nDirector Scott revealed to the same publication that he discovered Mescal when watching the actor in his breakout role as Connell Waldron in Normal People.\n\nThe filmmaker said Mescal was \"a special find\" and \"absolutely perfect\" for the role.\n\nGladiator II is set We do know \"Gladiator II\" is set 25-30 years after the first film, and that the cast is about as stacked as they come. Paul Mescal stars as Lucius Verus, son of Roman Empress Lucilla, who's played by a returning Connie Nielsen. Alongside Mescal, Denzel Washington will no doubt imbue the whole affair with an inhuman amount of on-screen charisma as Macrinus, a formerly enslaved individual who became wealthy and began supplying weapons to the Romans. Alongside these two top-tier actors, \"Gladiator II\" will also star Joseph Quinn, Pedro Pascal, May Calamawy, Peter Mensah, Matt Lucas, Fred Hechinger, and Derek Jacobi. Not bad, really, and a good way to make up for the fact that Russell Crowe and Joaquin Phoenix will, of course, not be returning this time around.\n\nWith 24 years of anticipation propelling it, a stellar cast, a gigantic budget that may prevent the film from becoming a box office hit, and a set that made Crowe himself jealous, \"Gladiator II\" was already shaping up to be one of 2024's most-hyped films. Paramount Pictures has unleashed the official trailer for Ridley Scott's Gladiator II, and it's nothing short of a blood-soaked, adrenaline-pumping beast of a film! Set to storm into cinemas on November 22, this long-awaited sequel brings Paul Mescal as an all-grown-up Lucius, the once-innocent child now a fierce gladiator in the unforgiving arenas of Rome. Get ready for intense battles, epic showdowns, and a fiery return to the brutal world of the Colosseum! Lucius, the son of Lucilla and nephew of the infamous Commodus, is back to settle scores and confront new enemies. {"uri": "8217343332", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-07-09", "time": "16:46:36", "dateTime": "2024-07-09T16:46:36Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-07-09T16:46:11Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.6745098233222961, "url": "https://nypost.com/2024/07/09/entertainment/shirtless-paul-mescal-pedro-pascal-battle-in-gladiator-ii-trailer/", "title": "Shirtless Paul Mescal and Pedro Pascal have bloody arena battle in...", "body": "The trailer for Ridley Scott's highly-anticipated sequel \"Gladiator II\" dropped on Tuesday, setting the stage for the return to Ancient Rome.\n\nWritten by David Scarpa, the first look showcases the world 20-plus years after the events of the Russell Crowe-led 2000 historical epic.\n\nPaul Mescal now steps into the role of Lucius, which Spencer Treat Clark portrayed in the original movie. Lucius is the son of Lucilla (Connie Nielsen) and nephew of Commodus, who was originally played by Joaquin Phoenix.\n\nThe plot follows Lucius, who witnessed the death of Maximus (Crowe) as a child at the hands of his uncle.\n\nHe was then sent by his mother as a child to live on the northern coast of Africa to shield him from the corruption and violence of Rome.\n\nAs an adult, he gets thrown back into Roman life and into captivity after his home is conquered by General Marcus Acacius (Pedro Pascal) and his forces who lead Rome with an iron fist.\n\nLucius is then forced into the Colosseum to battle, where he must fight for the future of the Roman people.\n\nThe trailer also introduces Denzel Washington as Macrinus, who is a wealthy arms dealer entangled in the spectacle of gladiators and the film's two main antagonists: twin emperors Caracalla (Fred Hechinger) and Geta (Joseph Quinn).\n\nDerek Jacobi is reprising his role as Gracchus, while May Calamawy, Lior Raz, Peter Mensah AND Matt Lucas round out the star-studded cast.\n\nScott, 86, returns to direct the follow-up to his award-winning \"Gladiator,\" and he brings along a seasoned team, such as cinematographer John Mathieson, production designer Arthur Max, and costume designer Janty Yates.\n\nThe original won five Oscars and grossed $465.4 million worldwide, becoming the second highest-grossing film of that year.\n\nMescal, 28, reflected on the project during an interview with Entertainment Tonight in July.\n\n\"It's an immense honor -- it's not lost on me,\" he said at the time. \"That film is hugely important to a lot of people across the world. And for the great Ridley Scott to kind of pass the baton on to me is something that, like, my drama school self or even the version of myself that was 15 watching the film for the first time, could never have imagined.\"\n\nThe \"Normal People\" actor said he took on the role as Lucius with a \"great deal of pride.\"\n\n\"There was a lot of work that went into it,\" he went on of his transformation. \"Lots of lifting heavy things... lots of squatting, pushing, pulling. We didn't kind of change the wheel with it, it was all kind of pretty standard in that regard, but I was keen for it not to look false or kind of overly aesthetic in any way.\"\n\nPascal, 49, meanwhile, called his co-star \"Brick Wall Paul.\"\n\n\"It's brutal, man,\" he told Vanity Fair that same month. \"He got so strong. I would rather be thrown from a building than have to fight him again. To go up against somebody that fit and that talented and that much younger.... Outside of Ridley being a total genius, Paul is a big reason as to why I would put my poor body through that experience.\"\n\nMescal said the entire experience overall was a \"pivotal\" moment for him.\n\n\"I think for a lot of us, especially the younger cohort of the cast, we would easily say that it's a job that changed our lives,\" he marveled.\n\n\"We're kind of waiting with bated breath, but the thing that I keep coming back to is, we've done it. We've gone and made it and nobody can take that away from us. And we had the king that is Ridley Scott at the helm -- it's amazing.\"\n\nThe \"All of Us Strangers\" star said the \"Roman\" nose he hated all his life is also what helped him get the role.\n\n\"My nose just is kind of Roman,\" Mescal told Vanity Fair. \"So it's useful in this context. The nose that I absolutely hated when I was in secondary school -- and used to get ribbed for -- became very, very useful when Ridley needed somebody to be in Gladiator II.\"\n\n\"I remember watching it with my dad and being absolutely blown away by it,\" he told ET of his admiration for the original film.\n\n\"It's been in the cultural zeitgeist for 20 years, and there's not a lot of films that have done that especially in this genre,\" he added. \"So there's a healthy amount of pressure but also a healthy amount of confidence from the people that made the film. We are excited to kind of add the next installment to a film that has been and will continue to be incredibly popular.\"", "source": {"uri": "nypost.com", "dataType": "news", "title": "New York The trailer shows Lucius meet Denzel Washington's character, who takes him under his wing. Lucius proves an adept fighter and leader in the ring, and it even teases a forthcoming duel between his character and Pedro Pascal's Roman warrior.\n\nNever miss a story -- sign up for PEOPLE's free daily newsletter to stay up-to-date on the best of what PEOPLE has to offer, from celebrity news to compelling human-interest stories.\n\nRelated: Paul Mescal Got 'Gladiator 2' Role After Producers Click inside to check out the action-packed trailer!\n\nFrom legendary director Ridley Scott (Gladiator, American Gangster), Gladiator II continues the epic saga of power, intrigue, and vengeance set in Ancient Rome. Years after witnessing the death of the revered hero Maximus at the hands of his uncle, Lucius (Paul Mescal) is forced to enter the Colosseum after his home is conquered by the tyrannical Emperors who now lead Rome with an iron fist. With rage in his heart and the future of the Empire at stake, Lucius must look to his past to find strength and honor to return the glory of Rome to its people.\n\nIn addition to Mescal, the film's amazing cast includes Pedro Pascal (Kingsman: The Golden Circle, Equalizer 2, The Mandalorian), Joseph Quinn (Stranger Things), Fred Hechinger (The White Lotus), Lior Raz (Fauda, Hit & Run), Derek Jacobi (Gladiator, The Crown), Connie Nielsen (Wonder Woman) and Denzel Washington (Training Day, American Gangster, Fences).\n\nGladiator II was written by David Scarpa, from a story by Peter Craig and Scarpa. Walter Parkes, Laurie MacDonald, Raymond Kirk and Aidan Elliott executive produced the film. Producer responsibilities were taken on by Douglas Wick, Ridley Scott, Lucy Fisher, Michael Pruss and David Franzoni.\n\nThe Gladiator sequel will arrive in theaters on November 22nd. The sequel takes place between 192 AD, when Commodus died in Gladiator, and 209-211 AD, when Caracalla and Geta ruled Rome.\n\nOver 20 years after the original historical epic was released, Gladiator II is set to pick up years after Russell Crowe's Maximus Decimus Meridius died in the Colosseum.\n\nA new trailer for Gladiator II has given some new insights into the upcoming film, and how it fits in with the original Gladiator's timeline.\n\nBased on Gladiator II's Roman Emperors, Caracalla and Geta, it seems that the sequel takes place about 19 years after the original. In real life, Emperor Commodus, Joaquin Pheonix's character in Gladiator, died in 192 AD, and Caracalla and Geta ruled together from 209 to 211 AD.\n\nGladiator II\n\nNot Yet Rated\n\nAction\n\nDrama\n\nEpic\n\nHistory\n\nAdventure\n\nGladiator 2 is the follow-up to Ridley Scott's award-winning film Gladiator from 2000. {"uri": "8215748088", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-07-08", "time": "18:33:03", "dateTime": "2024-07-08T18:33:03Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-07-08T18:32:22Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.6705882549285889, "url": "https://www.gamespot.com/articles/gladiator-2-poster-takes-us-back-to-the-arena-first-trailer-tomorrow/1100-6524764/", "title": "Gladiator 2 Poster Takes Us Back To The Arena; First Trailer Tomorrow", "body": "It's been 24 years since the first Gladiator and we get our first look tomorrow at the sequel.\n\nFans who have been waiting for a look at the sequel to 2000's Gladiator will finally get their chance tomorrow, when the trailer officially premieres. It's been almost two and a half decades since Ridley Scott released the sand-and-sandals epic, Gladiator, which took home five Oscars including Best Picture and Best Actor for Russell Crowe. In anticipation of the trailer, Paramount debuted the first teaser poster.\n\nWhile Maximus' story ended in Gladiator, it's now his Commodus' nephew Lucius (this time around played by Paul Mescal) to take to the arena against the Roman general Marcus Acacius (Pedro Pascal). Years later, we find the former emperor-to-be Lucius living in Africa outside the Roman Empire, When Acacius comes to conquer it, he captures Lucius and brings him back to Rome to fight in the arena. Lucius' mother Lucilla (the returning Connie Nielsen) is now in love with the Roman general and doesn't recognize her son after years away.\n\nThe only footage that has been seen of the film was released during CinemaCon earlier this year showed Mescal fighting a rhino and baboons, Roman political intrigue, and emperors described as being \"even more diabolical than Joaquin Phoenix's Commodus\" in the first movie.\n\nThe photos revealed Monday had Mescal looking shredded and in fighting form, so it's almost assuredly going to include some one-on-one sword fighting and taking on animals, similarly to what the original Gladiator trailer showed with the soldiers taking on a tiger.\n\nA sequel to the original blockbuster has been in development in one form or another since a year after the film's initial success. One script that floated around was set fifteen years later, centered on a young adult Lucius searching for the truth about his biological father. However things evolved from there to include Maximus' resurrection and his journey through the afterlife.\n\nEven stranger was when musician Nick Cave was commissioned to write a new draft which involved to \"deities vs. deity vs. humanity\" story. The outlandish premise involved Maximus in purgatory, who is resurrected as an immortal eternal warrior and sent to Earth to kill Jesus Christ. However Maximus is tricked into murdering his own son and cursed to keep fighting for all time. The treatment even included the gladiator fighting in the Crusades, WWII, and the Vietnam War.\n\nRidley Scott was nominated for Best Director for the first film but lost out to Steven Soderberg for Traffic. {"uri": "8217021451", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-07-09", "time": "13:21:38", "dateTime": "2024-07-09T13:21:38Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-07-09T13:21:26Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.658823549747467, "url": "https://www.usmagazine.com/entertainment/news/gladiator-ii-trailer-shirtless-paul-mescal-fights-pedro-pascal/", "title": "Shirtless Paul Mescal Goes Against Pedro Pascal in 'Gladiator II' Trailer", "body": "After Mescal declares that he wishes to go up against the \"entire Roman Army,\" the trailer took a more modern turn playing \"No Church in the Wild\" by Jay-Z, Kanye West and Frank Ocean (a callback to 2014's The Great Gatsby, perhaps).\n\nThe sequel is directed and coproduced by Ridley Scott, who also directed the original film, with a script written by David Scarpa. The story follows Lucius (Mescal), the former heir of the Roman Empire, who becomes a gladiator after his home is invaded by the Roman army, led by general Marcus Acacius (Pedro Pascal) during the reign of coemperors Caracalla (Fred Hechinger) and Geta (Joseph Quinn). Washington, meanwhile, portrays Macrinus, a very wealthy arms dealer who uses gladiators for sport.\n\nIt's clear that the movie will feature many a montage of Washington training Mescal as his muse to take on Pascal in the Colosseum. While the final battle is only teased, it seems things will get bloody as the protagonists go head to head. There is also a callback to the original Gladiator when Connie Nielsen as Lucilla gives Mescal the late Maximus' ring.\n\nGladiator II was discussed as early as 2001, but development was halted when DreamWorks sold the rights and property to Paramount in 2006. The official rollout for the sequel began in 2018 and Mescal was cast as the lead role in January 2023. The movie comes after the 2000 film, which starred Russell Crowe, earned five Oscars and 11 nominations including Best Picture and Best Actor.\n\nWhile the role remains his only Oscar, Crowe, 60, has made it clear he won't be returning as Maximus. Those who know the film shouldn't be surprised, as -- spoiler alert -- his character baited opponent Commodus (Joaquin Phoenix) into the Colosseum during the movie's final act, killing him before dying of wounds he sustained in the battle.\n\n\"They should be fucking paying me for the amount of questions I am asked about a film I am not even in,\" Crowe joked at the Karlovy Vary Film Festival earlier this year. \"It has nothing to do with me. In that world, I am dead. Six feet under. But I do admit to a certain tinge of jealousy, because it reminds me of when I was younger and what it meant for me, in my life.\"\n\nDespite not being able to step back into the world of the Roman Empire, Crowe noted that the film was more than deserving of a follow up feature. \"I don't know anything about the cast, I don't know anything about the plot. I am dead! But I know that if Ridley has decided to do a second part of the story, over 20 years later, he must have had very strong reasons,\" Crowe continued. \"I can't think of this movie being anything other than spectacular.\"\n\nAs for passing the mantle on to Mescal, Scott told Vanity Fair last month that he became interested in the actor while watching his 2020 Hulu limited series, Normal People.\n\n\"When I watch anything, I tend to be clocking who's interesting,\" he told the outlet at the time. \"It's just in my DNA. And so, watching a TV show that's not really my kind of TV show almost four years ago, I said, 'Who's this guy?'\"\n\nWhen Gladiator II became more of a tangent possibility, Scott said the duo met up on Zoom -- and the rest is history. \"I met with him and he said, 'Of course, I'd love to do it.' And that was it,\" he recalled. \"We were away and running with the ball. He was a special find. He was absolutely perfect.\"\n\nMescal, for his part, confirmed that he and Scott only spoke \"for about 20 to 30 minutes\" before the plan was set in motion.\n\n\"I wanted to get a flavor from him about what the story was going to be about, so we spent about 15 minutes talking about that, and then we spent another 10 minutes talking about the sport that I played growing up -- Gaelic football,\" he explained. \"Maybe that was something that helped with it, in that I'm used to being physical in my body.\"\n\nMescal noted that the official offer for the role came in about \"two or three weeks later.\" He also credited his nose -- it's \"kind of Roman,\" he told VF -- for being the right fit for Lucius. \"The nose that I absolutely hated when I was in secondary scho l -- and used to get ribbed for -- became very, very useful when Ridley needed somebody to be in Gladiator II,\" he quipped.", "source": {"uri": "usmagazine.com", "dataType": "news", "title": "Us Weekly"}, "authors": The new movie, which recently released its first trailer, hits United States theaters this November.\n\nCheck out the Gladiator II character posters, via an X post from Regal, below:\n\n\"From legendary director Ridley Scott, Gladiator II continues the epic saga of power, intrigue, and vengeance set in Ancient Rome,\" the official synopsis reads. \"Years after witnessing the death of the revered hero Maximus at the hands of his uncle, Lucius (Paul Mescal) is forced to enter the Colosseum after his home is conquered by the tyrannical Emperors who now lead Rome with an iron fist. With rage in his heart and the future of the Empire at stake, Lucius must look to his past to find strength and honor to return the glory of Rome to its people.\"\n\nThe screenplay was written by David Scarpa (who recently worked with Scott on 2023's Napoleon starring Joaquin Phoenix), based on a story by Scarpa and Peter Craig. In addition to directing the film, Scott produces Gladiator II alongside Douglas Wick, Lucy Fisher, Michael Pruss, and David Franzoni. Walter Parkes, Laurie MacDonald, Raymond Kirk, and Aidan Elliot serve as executive producers.\n\nGladiator II will be released in United States theaters on November 15, 2024, from Paramount Pictures. {"uri": "8217318616", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-07-09", "time": "16:28:53", "dateTime": "2024-07-09T16:28:53Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-07-09T16:28:19Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.6509804129600525, "url": "https://www.outkick.com/culture/gladiator-2-trailer-just-dropped-its-awesome", "title": "'Gladiator 2' Trailer Is Awesome But May Have Spoiled Too Much", "body": "A new trailer for the upcoming Gladiator 2 movie is hoping fans answer the original film's classic question, \"Are you not entertained?!\" with a resounding \"YES\" as loud as the Colosseum crowd.\n\nThe over 3-minute trailer gives movie fans their biggest insight yet as to what they can expect with Director Ridley Scott's return to Rome in the followup to his 2000 smash hit 'Gladiator.' The only problem is that the trailer may give a little too much detail as it appears to be edited in timeline order, perhaps spoiling how the story will play out. Not only that, but the fact that the sheer length of 3 minutes these days can come across as an eternity on social media, some are worried that, in an attempt to prove its worthiness, the film went over the top with this morning's trailer.\n\nRegardless, the trailer itself looks AWESOME and although sequels rarely live up to the hype of the original, from this preview alone, I don't think Paramount Pictures will have any difficulty generating enough buzz to recoup their $250-$300 million budget. God knows the box office needs it, with not one film grossing $100 million in tis opening weekend leading into Memorial Day.\n\nLet's delve into the film itself.\n\nFans will immediately notice that the storyline continues just 20 years after the first one ended.\n\nThe official synopsis of the Gladiator sequel reads:\n\n\"From legendary director Ridley Scott, 'Gladiator II' continues the epic saga of power, intrigue, and vengeance set in Ancient Rome. Years after witnessing the death of the revered hero Maximus at the hands of his uncle, Lucius (Mescal) is forced to enter the Colosseum after his home is conquered by the tyrannical Emperors who now lead Rome with an iron fist. With rage in his heart and the future of the Empire at stake, Lucius must look to his past to find strength and honor to return the glory of Rome to its people.\"\n\nSome old familiar faces return to the screen - Connie Wilson will once again play Roman Emperor Commodus (played byr Joaquin Phoenix in the original) and sister Lucilla. Her son Lucius - who we last saw running around the Coliseum as a young boy emulating his uncle Commodus, while also taking a particular liking to 'The Spaniard,' Maximus Decimus Meridius who was played by Russel Crowe, will be the central focus of Gladiator 2.\n\nIrish actor Paul Mescal will take up the incredibly difficult task of trying to live up to the performance that Russel Crowe put forth in the original film - a role that landed him the Oscar for Best Lead Actor.\n\nMescal's task may be as difficult as a slave trying to fight his way through a gauntlet of gladiators in ancient Roman times, but at least he will have some help from some iconic actors like Denzel Washington as well as supporting cast members like Stranger Things' Joseph Quinn and Pedro Pascal,\n\nYou can be sure that the CGI is going to go WILD in this movie and be downright incredible. At one point in the trailer they add water to one of the arenas, and it looks absolutely crazy, not to mention what I suspect will be some pretty bloody fight scenes.\n\n\"I can't tell you how stressed I am talking about that film in particular, because it's definitely the biggest one I've done,\" Mescal told Esquire in an interview about the upcoming film. \"I feel really excited, but, like, it's difficult to get away from the legacy of the film a bit. I think it's really well written, and it pays homage to the first one, but it's very much something that I think I can step into and make comfortably my own.\"\n\nFans will be able to decide for themselves when the movie hits theaters November 22nd - right before the Thanksgiving holiday week.\n\nOnly instead of one Roman Emperor giving the thumbs up or thumbs down on the film's fate,
